commit_message:
Purge self.policies from Swift

Since we decided to go with a global policy set that we swap out in
tests, we don't need these dependency-injection remnants any more.

Change-Id: I43411f774c09bd1197db70c3ca8889ba49009e2d

commit_message:
Retry failed create on update

Before this change, a create that failed would result in a death sentence
for the stack. The only way to recover would be to delete and re-create
the entire stack. For a large stack, this can be extremely time
consuming and painful.

With this change, any resources that are in a create failed state will
be explicitly deleted on update. This will cause the update process to
see them as missing and thus it will attempt to create them.

This should lay the groundwork for a more extensive change which will
allow retrying updates as well.

implements bp retry-failed-update

Change-Id: Ie41d866e1cafd8731387c4d5a316f0a6da4e2f87

commit_message:
Miscellaneous renaming string fixes

* Fixes for readme files, help, errors, comments
* Includes the name change for the guest agent and
  the topic name in agent_remote.py.
* Changes default config file to /etc/sahara/sahara.conf
  in sahara_api.py
* Change log and i8ln strings to 'sahara'
* Change project string in CONF object to 'sahara'

Partial-Implements: blueprint savanna-renaming-service
Change-Id: Ic353a013a0c7bb76f6724590bf1f558f6aafbede

commit_message:
Iteration over links in flow interface

In addition to iteration over its children (atoms or subflows) each
pattern now provides iter_links() method that iterates over
dependency links. This allows engines to treat all patterns
in the same way instead knowing what structure each pattern expresses.

Change-Id: I52cb5b0b501eefc8eb56a9ef5303aeb318013e11

commit_message:
Filter LDAP dumb member when listing role assignments

When the LDAP assignment driver is used and the "use_dumb_member"
configuration option is enabled, the dumb member is listed when
listing the role assignments. This can be seen by running the live
LDAP tests, as the "test_list_role_assignments_unfiltered" test will
fail due to the additional role assignments for the dumb member.

This patch filters out the LDAP dumb member when listing role
assignments.

Change-Id: I585d54847778f02621b8201644ec9285495a63aa
Closes-Bug: 1280965

commit_message:
Removed openstacksdk from projects.txt

For now. Eventually it will be re-added, but right now the coordination
costs are higher than the value derived when we aren't even incubating.

Change-Id: I617c24cf02fe83c1fdf0a5e6b90a92851626890c

commit_message:
unify log_task_wrapper and log_deploy_warpper

These two log wrappers are implemented in nearly same way. This patch
merge it into one wrapper.

At the same time, those two method are not removed, because I think this
is a good way to keep code compatibility.

Change-Id: Ibd0f1d1f6a28acfd30e29d21446171f9a2f15ded
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/rally refs/changes/31/81731/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def log_wrapper(obj, log, msg, **kw): Class instances that use this decorator should have self.task or self.deployment attribute. The wrapper produces logs messages both before and after the method execution, in the following format (example for tasks): :param obj: task or deployment which must be attribute of 'self' params = {"msg": msg % kw, "obj_name": obj.title(), "uuid": getattr(self, obj)["uuid"]} log(_("%(obj_name)s %(uuid)s | Starting: %(msg)s") % params) log(_("%(obj_name)s %(uuid)s | Completed: %(msg)s") % params)def log_task_wrapper(log, msg, **kw): return log_wrapper('task', log, msg, **kw) def log_deploy_wrapper(log, msg, **kw): return log_wrapper('deployment', log, msg, **kw)
deleted_lines: def log_task_wrapper(log, msg, **kw): Class instances that use this decorator should have self.task attribute. The wrapper produces logs messages both before and after the method execution, in the following format: params = {"msg": msg % kw, "task": self.task["uuid"]} log(_("Task %(task)s | Starting: %(msg)s") % params) log(_("Task %(task)s | Completed: %(msg)s") % params)# TODO(akscram): It's a very similar to the "log_task_wrapper", we will # should to reduce code duplication here. def log_deploy_wrapper(log, msg, **kw): """A logging wrapper for any method of a class. Class instances that use this decorator should have self.deployment attribute. The wrapper produces logs messages both before and after the method execution, in the following format: "Deployment <Deployment UUID> | Starting: <Logging message>" [Method execution...] "Deployment <Deployment UUID> | Completed: <Logging message>" :param log: Logging method to be used, e.g. LOG.info :param msg: Text message (possibly parameterized) to be put to the log :param **kw: Parameters for msg """ def decorator(f): @functools.wraps(f) def wrapper(self, *args, **kwargs): params = {"msg": msg % kw, "deploy": self.deployment["uuid"]} log(_("Deployment %(deploy)s | Starting: %(msg)s") % params) result = f(self, *args, **kwargs) log(_("Deployment %(deploy)s | Completed: %(msg)s") % params) return result return wrapper return decorator

commit_message:
Fix typo and add test for refresh_instance_security_rules

Change Ia36b0dfb adds virt driver API method
refresh_instance_security_rules but there is a typo in the method's
docstring and it needs to be covered in test_virt_drivers.py.

Closes-Bug: #1290036

Change-Id: Idacffe2087f0bec6290e3422d1e777376b489615

commit_message:
Catch NotFound exception on user delete_key

Deleting a key which doesn't exist shouldn't cause a failure. Catch
NotFound exceptions so delete can succeed in this case.

Change-Id: If651a2936862f8ed2168c2c216ef6df8e944d6ba
Closes-Bug: #1291060

commit_message:
Switch from oslo.sphinx to oslosphinx

oslo.sphinx is deprecated because it causes namespace issues with
the other oslo libraries.  The new name for it is oslosphinx.

Change-Id: Ie8f9ca642f0b1d55048b0011d18c224de1e90631
Closes-Bug: #1277168

commit_message:
Extending quota support neutron LBaaS entities

Note: This change is a continuation of the abandoned
      change https://review.openstack.org/#/c/59192/
      Previous change was abandoned due to rebase problem.

Extending quota mechanism to support neutron
LBaaS entities. Adding quota for vips, pools, members
and health monitors.

This is one of four changes related to the BP.
This one is for python-neutronclient package.
Another one is for neutron project, another for tempest project
and another one for horizon/openstack-dashboard project.

See blueprint neutron-quota-extension for another two changes.

Change-Id: I2bfb974d513bd21b4dac6c90ddc6ede19797caf9
Implements: blueprint neutron-quota-extension

commit_message:
Move negative tests for test_images

This submission adds new test script "test_images_negative.py"
Which has negative tests separated from test_images.py

Partially implements blueprint negative-test-files

Change-Id: Id9b841b9cfca6461185674b7bf2c3777a130a900
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tempest refs/changes/12/77112/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Copyright 2012 OpenStack Foundation # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. from tempest.api.compute import base from tempest.common.utils import data_utils from tempest import config from tempest import exceptions from tempest import test CONF = config.CONF class ImagesNegativeTestJSON(base.BaseV2ComputeTest): _interface = 'json' @classmethod def setUpClass(cls): super(ImagesNegativeTestJSON, cls).setUpClass() if not CONF.service_available.glance: skip_msg = ("%s skipped as glance is not available" % cls.__name__) raise cls.skipException(skip_msg) cls.client = cls.images_client cls.servers_client = cls.servers_client cls.image_ids = [] def tearDown(self): """Terminate test instances created after a test is executed.""" for image_id in self.image_ids: self.client.delete_image(image_id) self.image_ids.remove(image_id) super(ImagesNegativeTestJSON, self).tearDown() def __create_image__(self, server_id, name, meta=None): resp, body = self.client.create_image(server_id, name, meta) image_id = data_utils.parse_image_id(resp['location']) self.client.wait_for_image_status(image_id, 'ACTIVE') self.image_ids.append(image_id) return resp, body @test.attr(type=['negative', 'gate']) def test_create_image_from_deleted_server(self): # An image should not be created if the server instance is removed resp, server = self.create_test_server(wait_until='ACTIVE') # Delete server before trying to create server self.servers_client.delete_server(server['id']) self.servers_client.wait_for_server_termination(server['id']) # Create a new image after server is deleted name = data_utils.rand_name('image') meta = {'image_type': 'test'} self.assertRaises(exceptions.NotFound, self.__create_image__, server['id'], name, meta) @test.attr(type=['negative', 'gate']) def test_create_image_from_invalid_server(self): # An image should not be created with invalid server id # Create a new image with invalid server id name = data_utils.rand_name('image') meta = {'image_type': 'test'} resp = {} resp['status'] = None self.assertRaises(exceptions.NotFound, self.__create_image__, '!@#$%^&*()', name, meta) @test.attr(type=['negative', 'gate']) def test_create_image_from_stopped_server(self): resp, server = self.create_test_server(wait_until='ACTIVE') self.servers_client.stop(server['id']) self.servers_client.wait_for_server_status(server['id'], 'SHUTOFF') self.addCleanup(self.servers_client.delete_server, server['id']) snapshot_name = data_utils.rand_name('test-snap-') resp, image = self.create_image_from_server(server['id'], name=snapshot_name, wait_until='ACTIVE', wait_for_server=False) self.addCleanup(self.client.delete_image, image['id']) self.assertEqual(snapshot_name, image['name']) @test.attr(type=['negative', 'gate']) def test_create_image_specify_uuid_35_characters_or_less(self): # Return an error if Image ID passed is 35 characters or less snapshot_name = data_utils.rand_name('test-snap-') test_uuid = ('a' * 35) self.assertRaises(exceptions.NotFound, self.client.create_image, test_uuid, snapshot_name) @test.attr(type=['negative', 'gate']) def test_create_image_specify_uuid_37_characters_or_more(self): # Return an error if Image ID passed is 37 characters or more snapshot_name = data_utils.rand_name('test-snap-') test_uuid = ('a' * 37) self.assertRaises(exceptions.NotFound, self.client.create_image, test_uuid, snapshot_name) @test.attr(type=['negative', 'gate']) def test_delete_image_with_invalid_image_id(self): # An image should not be deleted with invalid image id self.assertRaises(exceptions.NotFound, self.client.delete_image, '!@$%^&*()') @test.attr(type=['negative', 'gate']) def test_delete_non_existent_image(self): # Return an error while trying to delete a non-existent image non_existent_image_id = '11a22b9-12a9-5555-cc11-00ab112223fa' self.assertRaises(exceptions.NotFound, self.client.delete_image, non_existent_image_id) @test.attr(type=['negative', 'gate']) def test_delete_image_blank_id(self): # Return an error while trying to delete an image with blank Id self.assertRaises(exceptions.NotFound, self.client.delete_image, '') @test.attr(type=['negative', 'gate']) def test_delete_image_non_hex_string_id(self): # Return an error while trying to delete an image with non hex id image_id = '11a22b9-120q-5555-cc11-00ab112223gj' self.assertRaises(exceptions.NotFound, self.client.delete_image, image_id) @test.attr(type=['negative', 'gate']) def test_delete_image_negative_image_id(self): # Return an error while trying to delete an image with negative id self.assertRaises(exceptions.NotFound, self.client.delete_image, -1) @test.attr(type=['negative', 'gate']) def test_delete_image_id_is_over_35_character_limit(self): # Return an error while trying to delete image with id over limit self.assertRaises(exceptions.NotFound, self.client.delete_image, '11a22b9-12a9-5555-cc11-00ab112223fa-3fac') class ImagesNegativeTestXML(ImagesNegativeTestJSON): _interface = 'xml'

commit_message:
Fixes the Hyper-V agent individual ports metrics

Replaces aggregated metric values with separated values for each port.

Co-Authored-By: Adrian Vladu <avladu@cloudbasesolutions.com>
Change-Id: Ie946dff984ef53f014c6c57f8d1d5bb9c6e7596d
Closes-Bug: #1289007

commit_message:
Never specify project_name in keystone v3 auth

All of our middlewares populate the context with both the tenant name and the
tenant_id. The tenant_id, is unique across domains which means you can do lookups
without having to know what domain the project is in.

When project_id and project_name are both specified, it seems that project_name
takes precedence, which will fail when the credentials are from the stack domain since
we cannot lookup by project names when the domain is not specified.

It looks like specifying project_name is never the right thing to do, and we should
assume that the context always has a tenant_id.

Change-Id: Ifea21e13be482a6347438d6baaca3111caad4a97
Closes-Bug: #1290621

commit_message:
Networks,Ports: delete with subnet, port with no IP

Following tests are added:
 - Delete a subnet by deleting the network it is associated with
 - Test create port with no IP address

Change-Id: Ia6ff87b122615fea685cc645cd0213cda2a769b7

added_lines: from tempest import clients def test_delete_network_with_subnet(self): # Creates a network name = data_utils.rand_name('network-') resp, body = self.client.create_network(name) self.assertEqual('201', resp['status']) network = body['network'] net_id = network['id'] # Find a cidr that is not in use yet and create a subnet with it cidr = netaddr.IPNetwork(self.network_cfg.tenant_network_cidr) mask_bits = self.network_cfg.tenant_network_mask_bits for subnet_cidr in cidr.subnet(mask_bits): try: resp, body = self.client.create_subnet(net_id, str(subnet_cidr)) break except exceptions.BadRequest as e: is_overlapping_cidr = 'overlaps with another subnet' in str(e) if not is_overlapping_cidr: raise self.assertEqual('201', resp['status']) subnet = body['subnet'] subnet_id = subnet['id'] # Delete network while the subnet still exists resp, body = self.client.delete_network(net_id) self.assertEqual('204', resp['status']) # Verify that the subnet got automatically deleted. self.assertRaises(exceptions.NotFound, self.client.show_subnet, subnet_id) class SharedNetworksTestJSON(base.BaseAdminNetworkTest): _interface = 'json' """ These tests are performed with with Admin's credentials. Tests the following operations in the Neutron API using the REST client for Neutron: - create a shared network, show the network details and verify the network is shared - create a netowrk on behalf of other tenant, show the network details and verify that the network is created for other tenant. v2.0 of the Neutron API is assumed. """ @classmethod def setUpClass(cls): super(SharedNetworksTestJSON, cls).setUpClass() admin_manager = clients.AdminManager() cls.admin_client = admin_manager.network_client cls.identity_admin_client = admin_manager.identity_client @attr(type='smoke') def test_shared_networks(self): # Creates a shared network name = data_utils.rand_name('shared_network-') resp, body = self.admin_client.create_network(name, shared=True) self.assertEqual('201', resp['status']) network = body['network'] #Verify that the network actually got created resp, body = self.admin_client.show_network(network['id']) self.assertEqual('200', resp['status']) resp_network = body['network'] self.assertEqual(resp_network['id'], network['id']) self.assertEqual(resp_network['name'], network['name']) self.assertTrue(resp_network['shared']) resp, body = self.admin_client.delete_network(network['id']) self.assertEqual('204', resp['status']) @attr(type='smoke') def test_create_networks_for_other_tenants(self): # Add a tenant to conduct the test test_tenant = data_utils.rand_name('test_tenant_') test_description = data_utils.rand_name('desc_') _, tenant = self.identity_admin_client.create_tenant( name=test_tenant, description=test_description) tenant_id = tenant['id'] self.addCleanup(self.identity_admin_client.delete_tenant, tenant_id) # As an admin create network for other tenant name = data_utils.rand_name('other_tenant_network-') resp, body = self.admin_client.create_network(name, tenant_id=tenant_id) self.assertEqual('201', resp['status']) network = body['network'] #Verify that the network actually got created resp, body = self.admin_client.show_network(network['id']) self.assertEqual('200', resp['status']) resp_network = body['network'] self.assertEqual(resp_network['id'], network['id']) self.assertEqual(resp_network['name'], network['name']) self.assertEqual(resp_network['tenant_id'], network['tenant_id']) resp, body = self.admin_client.delete_network(network['id']) self.assertEqual('204', resp['status']) class SharedNetworksTestXML(SharedNetworksTestJSON): _interface = 'xml'

commit_message:
Use specific oozie for hadoop 2 plugin

Partially implements blueprint: vanilla-plugin-hadoop-2

Co-Authored-By: Ivan Berezovskiy <iberezovskiy@mirantis.com>

Change-Id: I46b6217c567db2e530d23a460a3b77a4681ae8f6
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/sahara-image-elements refs/changes/10/80610/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: install-packages wget if [ "$HADOOP_VERSION" = "1" ]; then cp -r /usr/share/hadoop/*.jar /opt/oozie/libext cp -r /usr/share/hadoop/lib/*.jar /opt/oozie/libext elif ["$HADOOP_VERSION" = "2" ]; then wget -P /opt/oozie/libtools/ "$EXTJS_DOWNLOAD_URL" /opt/oozie/bin/oozie-setup.sh prepare-war -d /opt/oozie/libtools else echo "Hadoop version $HADOOP_VERSION is not supported by oozie, exiting..." exit 1 fi

subject: Fix changing of storage policy index
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-02-11 02:57:37.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/swift/commit/11675bf0a1006bd637af4a8bfe319863b0321f23', 'message': 'Fix changing of storage policy index

The commit that the storage policy moved out of metadata and into
container_stat introduced a bug: if the client DELETEs and then PUTs a
container with a different storage policy, the resurrected container
still had the old policy. This is because the policy was being set in
broker.initialize(), but that was only being called for new
containers (no .db files at all).

Now the policy index is still set at initialization for new
containers, but it is updated for resurrected containers.

I considered using broker.set_storage_policy_index() for all
containers, new or resurrected, but that would leave a brief window of
time for new containers where the .db file has the default policy
index and not the user-specified one, and that seemed like a good home
for bugs to move into.

Change-Id: I496e5078df80ec1466c1d50ac62ae3700c5aeec0
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2014-02-11 17:45:11.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/swift/commit/40f6e782733cee406ea6a79d7bd75ee31a5d8f76', 'message': 'Fix changing of storage policy index

The commit that the storage policy moved out of metadata and into
container_stat introduced a bug: if the client DELETEs and then PUTs a
container with a different storage policy, the resurrected container
still had the old policy. This is because the policy was being set in
broker.initialize(), but that was only being called for new
containers (no .db files at all).

Now the policy index is still set at initialization for new
containers, but it is updated for resurrected containers.

I considered using broker.set_storage_policy_index() for all
containers, new or resurrected, but that would leave a brief window of
time for new containers where the .db file has the default policy
index and not the user-specified one, and that seemed like a good home
for bugs to move into.

Change-Id: I496e5078df80ec1466c1d50ac62ae3700c5aeec0
'}, {'number': 3, 'created': '2014-02-16 22:16:27.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/swift/commit/39e8afdccb2202e089bb06f7a83e3e7ad5c68a2a', 'message': 'Fix changing of storage policy index

The commit that the storage policy moved out of metadata and into
container_stat introduced a bug: if the client DELETEs and then PUTs a
container with a different storage policy, the resurrected container
still had the old policy. This is because the policy was being set in
broker.initialize(), but that was only being called for new
containers (no .db files at all).

Now the policy index is still set at initialization for new
containers, but it is updated for resurrected containers.

I considered using broker.set_storage_policy_index() for all
containers, new or resurrected, but that would leave a brief window of
time for new containers where the .db file has the default policy
index and not the user-specified one, and that seemed like a good home

commit_message:
Fix changing of storage policy index

The commit that the storage policy moved out of metadata and into
container_stat introduced a bug: if the client DELETEs and then PUTs a
container with a different storage policy, the resurrected container
still had the old policy. This is because the policy was being set in
broker.initialize(), but that was only being called for new
containers (no .db files at all).

Now the policy index is still set at initialization for new
containers, but it is updated for resurrected containers.

I considered using broker.set_storage_policy_index() for all
containers, new or resurrected, but that would leave a brief window of
time for new containers where the .db file has the default policy
index and not the user-specified one, and that seemed like a good home
for bugs to move into.

Change-Id: I496e5078df80ec1466c1d50ac62ae3700c5aeec0
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/swift refs/changes/36/72536/6 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def set_storage_policy_index(self, policy_index): def _setit(conn): conn.execute(""" UPDATE container_stat SET storage_policy_index = ?, misplaced_object_count = ( SELECT count(*) FROM object WHERE object.storage_policy_index <> ? AND object.deleted = 0) """, (policy_index, policy_index)) conn.commit() with self.get() as conn: try: _setit(conn) except sqlite3.OperationalError as err: if "no such column: storage_policy_index" not in str(err): raise self._migrate_add_storage_policy_index(conn) _setit(conn)

commit_message:
Add new tests to cover most of the requests port

After the merge to requests there was a few tests to be added to
properly cover the port and now reach 97% for coverage of
heatclient/common/http.

Change-Id: I8282459718968337f1bcd650d540509c418020c5

commit_message:
Comparisons should account for instantaneous test execution

The comparisons for the Revoke tests were greater than or less than, but if the test
did not take a full clock tick, the values could be equal.

Closes-Bug: 1295261

Change-Id: I7526640c283f13a4e4ed4f0b0ebd059bbe38ad9b

commit_message:
Allow specification of object devices for audit

In object audit "once" mode we are allowing the user to specify
a sub-set of devices to audit using the "--devices" command-line
option.  The sub-set is specified as a comma-separated list.  This
patch is taken from a larger patch to enable parallel processing
in the object auditor.

We've had to modify recon so that it will work properly with this
change to "once" mode.    We've modified dump_recon_cache()
so that it will store nested dictionaries, in other words it will
store a recon cache entry such as {'key1': {'key2': {...}}}. When
the object auditor is run in "once" mode with "--devices" set the
object_auditor_stats_ALL and ZBF entries look like:
{'object_auditor_stats_ALL': {'disk1disk2..diskn': {...}}}. When
swift-recon is run, it hunts through the nested dicts to find the
appropriate entries.  The object auditor recon cache entries are set
to {} at the beginning of each audit cycle, and individual disk
entries are cleared from cache at the end of each disk's audit cycle.

DocImpact

Change-Id: Icc53dac0a8136f1b2f61d5e08baf7b4fd87c8123
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/swift refs/changes/81/75881/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def object_audit_location_generator(devices, mount_check=True, logger=None, device_dirs=None): objects stored under that directory if device_dirs isn't set. If device_dirs is set, only yield AuditLocation for the objects under the entries in device_dirs. The AuditLocation only knows the path to the hash directory, not to the .data file therein (if any). This is to avoid a double listdir(hash_dir); the DiskFile object will always do one, so we don't. :device_dirs: a list of directories under devices to traverse if not device_dirs: device_dirs = listdir(devices) else: # remove bogus devices and duplicates from device_dirs device_dirs = list( set(listdir(devices)).intersection(set(device_dirs))) def object_audit_location_generator(self, device_dirs=None): self.logger, device_dirs)

subject: move the rsyslogd restart
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-03-19 23:15:29.000000000', 'files': ['lib/swift'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/devstack/commit/ad7e8c63e6891c59eb4387a01d94838f60370930', 'message': "move the rsyslogd restart

it's not clear why swift start is the place where an rsyslogd start
is happening, we should really only make this change when we actually
change a file on disk.

Also, use rsyslogd's -HUP signal directly instead of the system init

Change-Id: I1b9891313d67b1da2ca2582e532b2536a81f9b25

commit_message:
move the rsyslogd restart

it's not clear why swift start is the place where an rsyslogd start
is happening, we should really only make this change when we actually
change a file on disk.

Also, use rsyslogd's -HUP signal directly instead of the system init
scripts which are typically doing a stop and start, and apparently
racing under some circumstances.

Change-Id: I1b9891313d67b1da2ca2582e532b2536a81f9b25
Closes-Bug: #1262906
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/devstack refs/changes/63/81663/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # restart syslog to take the changes sudo killall -HUP rsyslogd

commit_message:
Disables the clear text password UI by default

The old way of assigning passwords in clear text to instances has been
superseded by the nova get-password feature. A corresponding UI
feature has been recently included in Horizon (see blueprint
"decrypt-and-display-vm-generated-password").

This commit disables the visualization of the old password UI by default.

Change-Id: Ia9a8b5c1c398054fb3d726b93f7fecc332b02efe
Closes-bug: #1291006
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/horizon refs/changes/36/79736/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: return features.get('can_set_password', False)

commit_message:
Ignore PortNotFound exceptions on lockless delete

Modifies the delete_ports_by_device_id method to
ignore PortNotFound exceptions because it has no
protection against concurrent operations deleting
the same ports that it's trying to delete.

Closes-Bug: #1293657
Change-Id: Icbcded149364a0e231ae811a440a691518bf20ad

commit_message:
Do auth_url.rstrip('/') only if auth_url is set

auth_url can be None, for example, when we use bypass_url.

Also, add rstrip('/') for bypass_url (and management_url), which
is done when management_url is gotten from service catalog.

Change-Id: I4f59cc405386a15f8a266d279b27f279eacdb7f1
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-novaclient refs/changes/93/80993/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: self.auth_url = auth_url.rstrip('/') if auth_url else auth_url

subject: Make backend container requests use the same X-Timestamp
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-03-18 03:40:59.000000000', 'files': ['test/unit/proxy/test_server.py', 'test/unit/__init__.py', 'swift/proxy/controllers/container.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/swift/commit/01410c685080c9d700278fc430cc004fa112d783', 'message': "Make backend container requests use the same X-Timestamp

The proxy.controllers.base's generate_request_headers will set an X-Timestamp
header for you if it didn't get populated by additional kwarg or the
transfer_headers method.  This works fine if you only call it once per
request, but because of how proxy.controllers.obj and
proxy.controllers.container fill in the backend update header chains in
_backend_requests we need multiple independent copies and call the base
controllers generate_request_headers once of each backend request - which left
the ContainerController sending down different X-Timestamp values
(microseconds apart) for PUT and DELETE.

The ObjectController skirts the issue entirely because it always preloads a
X-Timestamp on the req used to generate backend headers, and it allows it to
be copied over via transfer_headers by including 'x-timestamp' in it's
pass_through_headers attribute.

Because the container-replicator is already does merge_timestamps the
differences would always eventaully even out and there is no consistency bug,
but this seems cleaner since they put_timestamp being stored on the three
replicas during a container PUT were all coming from the same client request.

Since both PUT and DELETE were effected, and the ContainerController doesn't
need to allow X-Timestamp to pass_through like the ObjectController does for
container-sync, it seemed cleanest to fix the issue in _backend_requests via
the additional kwarg to generate_request_headers.

There's a driveby fix for FakeLogger and update to the proxy_server's
ContainerController tests.

Change-Id: Idbdf1204da33f8fb356ae35961dbdc931b228b77
"}]
commit_message:
Make backend container requests use the same X-Timestamp

The proxy.controllers.base's generate_request_headers will set an X-Timestamp
header for you if it didn't get populated by additional kwarg or the
transfer_headers method.  This works fine if you only call it once per
request, but because of how proxy.controllers.obj and
proxy.controllers.container fill in the backend update header chains in
_backend_requests we need multiple independent copies and call the base
controllers generate_request_headers once of each backend request - which left
the ContainerController sending down different X-Timestamp values
(microseconds apart) for PUT and DELETE.

The ObjectController skirts the issue entirely because it always preloads a
X-Timestamp on the req used to generate backend headers, and it allows it to
be copied over via transfer_headers by including 'x-timestamp' in it's
pass_through_headers attribute.

Because the container-replicator is already does merge_timestamps the
differences would always eventaully even out and there is no consistency bug,
but this seems cleaner since they put_timestamp being stored on the three
replicas during a container PUT were all coming from the same client request.

Since both PUT and DELETE were effected, and the ContainerController doesn't
need to allow X-Timestamp to pass_through like the ObjectController does for
container-sync, it seemed cleanest to fix the issue in _backend_requests via
the additional kwarg to generate_request_headers.

There's a driveby fix for FakeLogger and update to the proxy_server's
ContainerController tests.

Change-Id: Idbdf1204da33f8fb356ae35961dbdc931b228b77
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/swift refs/changes/58/81158/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: import time from swift.common.utils import public, csv_append, normalize_timestamp additional = {'X-Timestamp': normalize_timestamp(time.time())} headers = [self.generate_request_headers(req, transfer=True, additional=additional)
deleted_lines: from swift.common.utils import public, csv_append headers = [self.generate_request_headers(req, transfer=True)

commit_message:
Removes is_root_enabled from guest agent

Reasons:
- root-show/is_root_enabled api is implemented using
  trove.extensions.mysql.models.Root.load method but still guest-agent
  has the code which is tracking root user in guest database to detect
  if root is enabled or not.

Changes:
- Removed is_root_enabled from guest agent.
- Tests updated for is_root_enabled free guest-agent.
- For restore path extracted is_root_enabled in taskmanager.models
  packaged with backup_info

Change-Id: Ie7f8b4bba0512c2bd4ee96a0d555340019cec4c3
Implements: blueprint clean-up-guestagent-is-root-enable-api

subject: New multitool to run batched commands under ip netns and sudo (WIP)
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-01-17 15:22:44.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/1995959706d917ee4969512e6b15c00466cb218f', 'message': 'WIP Placeholder commit for a namespace multi-tool

My purpose for putting this up here is so that I can link to it from the
code sprint etherpad.  This will evolve in to a sort of network
namespace swiss-army knife:  an idea suggested by and discussed with
Mark at the code sprint in Montreal.  The motivation for this is to
batch individual shell commands in to logical operations in order to
reduce the number of times that we incur the overhead of rootwrap and
ip-netns-exec both of which seem to incur a non-trivial cost.

Change-Id: I3e0b0cfda79caa33629027b1d4cdf2b9cc6a3733

commit_message:
New multitool to run batched commands under ip netns and sudo (WIP)

I wanted to start showing some progress on this because it had fallen
out of priority for me since the code sprint.  I'm finally getting
back to it and I wanted reviewers to see what I'm up to.  Consider
this a prototype.

It has been observed that running commands under rootwrap and under
"ip netns exec" adds non-trivial overhead and slows down the agent.
This patch is an attempt to mitigate the overhead by grouping commands
in to batches that implement logical operations within a namespace so
that they can all be run under a single exec.

Change-Id: I3e0b0cfda79caa33629027b1d4cdf2b9cc6a3733
Closes-Bug: #1287824

commit_message:
WIP:Vmware VCenter neutron agent

This change is to add a neutron agent that connects to vcenter via vsphere SDK
to sync port groups(DVS port group and standard ESXi port group) into openstack
and map them to network objects in neutron for vm deployment usage.

Detail functions implemented as below:

*Parse agent configuration file
*Initialize vcenter api session
*Report agent state via RPC
*Import the ESXi host port groups from vCenter

Change-Id: Ieeee0fac2b923927c8b68261de0d1ef0c1eb2c78
Implements: blueprint vcenter-neutron-agent

added_lines: # Copyright 2014 IBM Corp. # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. import platform import re import time import eventlet from neutron import context from neutron.agent import rpc as agent_rpc from neutron.common import config as logging_config from neutron.common import constants as n_const from neutron.common import topics from neutron.openstack.common import log as logging from neutron.openstack.common import loopingcall from neutron.openstack.common.rpc import dispatcher from oslo.config import cfg LOG = logging.getLogger(__name__) #TODO(Xiang BZ ZHOU) # Add more configs. agent_opts = [ cfg.IntOpt( 'polling_interval', default=2, help='Agent report status interval'), cfg.ListOpt( 'physical_network_vswitch_mappings', default=[], help=_('List of <physical_network>:<vswitch> ')) ] CONF = cfg.CONF CONF.register_cli_opts(agent_opts, 'AGENT') class VCenterNeutronAgent(object): """ Vmware VCenter neutron agent. A class for create vcenter Login/management session and loop report agent state. """ RPC_API_VERSION = '1.0' def __init__(self): #TODO(Xiang BZ Zhou) # Replace with LOG module. self._polling_interval = CONF.AGENT.polling_interval self._load_physical_network_mappings() self._set_agent_state() self._setup_rpc() def _create_rpc_dispatcher(self): return dispatcher.RpcDispatcher([self]) def _load_whitelist(self): pass def _load_physical_network_mappings(self): self._physical_network_mappings = {} for mapping in CONF.AGENT.physical_network_vswitch_mappings: parts = mapping.split(':') if len(parts) != 2: LOG.debug(_('Invalid physical network mapping: %s'), mapping) else: pattern = re.escape(parts[0].strip()).replace('\\*', '.*') vswitch = parts[1].strip() self._physical_network_mappings[pattern] = vswitch def _filter_portgroup(self): pass #TODO(Xiang BZ Zhou) # Add more function prototype. def _report_state(self): try: self.state_rpc.report_state(self.context, self.agent_state) self.agent_state.pop('start_flag', None) except Exception as ex: LOG.exception(_("Failed reporting state! %s"), ex) def _set_agent_state(self): self.agent_state = { 'binary': 'neutron-vcenter-agent', 'host': cfg.CONF.host, 'topic': n_const.L2_AGENT_TOPIC, 'configurations': {'vswitch_mappings': {'phy1': 'vswitch1'}}, 'agent_type': 'Vcenter agent', 'start_flag': True} def _setup_rpc(self): self.agent_id = 'vcenter_%s' % platform.node() self.topic = topics.AGENT self.plugin_rpc = agent_rpc.PluginApi(topics.PLUGIN) self.state_rpc = agent_rpc.PluginReportStateAPI(topics.PLUGIN) # RPC network init self.context = context.get_admin_context_without_session() # Handle updates from service self.dispatcher = self._create_rpc_dispatcher() # Define the listening consumers for the agent consumers = [[topics.PORT, topics.UPDATE], [topics.NETWORK, topics.DELETE], [topics.PORT, topics.DELETE], ] # If u want to consume topic 'q-agent-notifier' message. #self.connection = agent_rpc.create_consumers(self.dispatcher, # self.topic, # consumers) report_interval = CONF.AGENT.report_interval if report_interval: heartbeat = loopingcall.LoopingCall(self._report_state) heartbeat.start(interval=report_interval) def daemon_loop(self): sync = True ports = set() while True: try: start = time.time() if sync: LOG.info(_("Agent out of sync with plugin!")) ports.clear() sync = False #TODO(Xiang BZ Zhou) # Add function you want to damon loop invoke. # Code from HyperV agent, so need to improve latter #port_info = self._update_ports(ports) port_info = None # notify plugin about port deltas if port_info: LOG.debug(_("Agent loop has new devices!")) # If treat devices fails - must resync with plugin sync = self._process_network_ports(port_info) ports = port_info['current'] except Exception as e: LOG.exception(_("Error in agent event loop: %s"), e) sync = True # sleep till end of polling interval elapsed = (time.time() - start) if (elapsed < self._polling_interval): time.sleep(self._polling_interval - elapsed) else: LOG.debug(_("Loop iteration exceeded interval " "(%(polling_interval)s vs. %(elapsed)s)"), {'polling_interval': self._polling_interval, 'elapsed': elapsed}) def get_existing_portgroup(self): pass def main(): eventlet.monkey_patch() cfg.CONF(project='neutron') logging_config.setup_logging(cfg.CONF) agent = VCenterNeutronAgent() LOG.info(_("Agent ,running.....")) agent.daemon_loop()

Changes from Rev #5

 - improve documentation in _get_service() function

Changes from Rev #6

 - fixed volume type creation bug. While revising the code, It was found a
   situation where the driver can fail when try to create a new target with a
   blank secret (In HNAS, all target must be created with a secret). Now, if
   the client is not using CHAP, we create the target with a dummy secret and
   then disable it.
 - __get_service() warns when chap_enable is false
 - remove confuse warning: "No secret configuration found ...". Now we just say
   we are retrieving the secret.
 - relocate CHAP log statement

Implements: blueprint hds-hnas
Change-Id: Iadbe4bcd0a230df3d1864579f623ad190b20f7c1

commit_message:
Implements HDS-Cinder HNAS Drivers Rev #7

This change introduces HDS HNAS iSCSI and NFS
Drivers

HNAS NFS certification results:
  https://gist.github.com/sombrafam/9416255

HNAS iSCSI certification results:
  https://gist.github.com/sombrafam/9493308

Changes from Rev #5

 - removed option 'chap_enabled' from cinder.conf
 - added parsing for option 'chap_enabled'.
 - improve documentation in _get_service() function

Changes from Rev #6

 - fixed volume type creation bug. While revising the code, It was found a
   situation where the driver can fail when try to create a new target with a
   blank secret (In HNAS, all target must be created with a secret). Now, if
   the client is not using CHAP, we create the target with a dummy secret and
   then disable it.
 - __get_service() warns when chap_enable is false
 - remove confuse warning: "No secret configuration found ...". Now we just say
   we are retrieving the secret.
 - relocate CHAP log statement

Implements: blueprint hds-hnas
Change-Id: Iadbe4bcd0a230df3d1864579f623ad190b20f7c1
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cinder refs/changes/71/74371/7 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: #hds_iscsi_config_file=/opt/hds/hnas/cinder_iscsi_conf.xml #hds_hnas_config_file=/opt/hds/hnass/cinder_hnas_conf.xml

commit_message:
Nova V2 APIs for Domain Quota Management

V2 APIs in Nova for using Domain Quota Driver to manage the quotas at domain, project and user level.
These APIs will enable Nova to enforce domain quotas. These APIs are implemented using new extension
domain-quota-sets.

Added Integration tests as well.

Author: Vinod Kumar Boppanna <vinod.kumar.boppanna@cern.ch>
Implements: blueprint domain-quota-driver-api
Change-Id: Ic3ac5653ce664ef9b49a29c23da9b0815c52bc3b

Adding testr/discover usage note with python 2.6

Using testr+tempset with python 2.6 requres a small change in
the discover package at the moment.

commit_message:
Make it clearer to admins that we're not using libguestfs.

We logged that we were falling back to local mounts, but only in
a debug message. Provide a clearer log message.

Change-Id: I5593a138c3711ae9f1831358f8922de259734aa2
Closes-Bug: 1240339
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/17/80117/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: LOG.info(_('libguestfs is not available, falling back to local ' 'mounts of the filesystem'))

commit_message:
Skip unit tests with storages when env variables aren't set

If CEILOMETER_TEST_MONGODB_URL or CEILOMETER_TEST_DB2_URL aren't set
then no exception raised and tests skipped

Change-Id: I407a332808c7c068cdca80edf17abfb2992a527f

commit_message:
Move migration for LB to grizzly

Tables are attempted to be created again if grizzly was running
with LoadBalancer plugin. This patches removes from chain redundant
upgrade script that is present already in grizzly and adds dependency
for creating needed tables in case LoadBalancer plugin is used.

Closes-bug: #1273355

Change-Id: I238a823e65d43b772fda951b03891b5c1e367fe5

commit_message:
Replace ad-hoc coroutines with Trollius coroutines

heat.engine.scheduler now uses the asyncio module of the Trollius project.

Change-Id: I350e20cfa7b75187c822e879f2d6ac98802d2ff0
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/heat refs/changes/25/77925/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: import asyncioclass LoopWrapper(object): def __init__(self): self._loop = None def get_loop(self): if self._loop is None: self._loop = asyncio.get_event_loop() self._loop.set_debug(True) return self._loop def step(self): self._loop._run_once() def __del__(self): if self._loop is not None: self._loop.close() _LOOP = LoopWrapper() def wallclock(): return _LOOP.get_loop().time() def asyncio_wrapper(task_runner, coro, timeout): task = task_runner._runner assert task is not None result = None exc = None while 1: # check timeout expired = timeout is not None and timeout.expired() if expired: logger.info(_('%s timed out') % str(task_runner)) # FIXME: exc may contain an existing exception (CancelledError?) exc = timeout else: logger.debug(_('%s running') % str(task_runner)) # execute one step of the coroutine try: if exc is not None: value = coro.throw(exc) else: value = coro.send(result) except StopIteration: logger.debug(_('%s complete') % str(task_runner)) task_runner._done = True raise except BaseException as exc: task_runner._exc = exc logger.debug(_('%s complete') % str(task_runner)) task_runner._done = True break else: if expired: # Clean up in case task swallows exception without exiting task_runner.cancel() break # get feedback from Task._step() try: result = yield value exc = None except Exception as err: result = None exc = err if expired: if task.done(): task_runner._done = True else: # Clean up in case task swallows exception without exiting task_runner.cancel() self._exc = None #eventlet.sleep(wait_time) #yield from asyncio.sleep(wait_time) coro = self._task(*self._args, **self._kwargs) if not isinstance(coro, types.GeneratorType): return if timeout is not None: timeout = Timeout(self, timeout) coro = asyncio_wrapper(self, coro, timeout) loop = _LOOP.get_loop() self._runner = asyncio.async(coro, loop=loop) self.step() if self._done: return True assert self._runner is not None, "Task not started" # FIXME: is it needed here? if self._exc is not None: raise self._exc assert not self._runner.done(), "asyncio Task is done" _LOOP.step() if self._exc is not None: raise self._exc self._runner.cancel() return asyncio.coroutine(task) tasks = [] tasks.append(r._runner)
deleted_lines: from time import time as wallclock eventlet.sleep(wait_time) if timeout is not None: self._timeout = Timeout(self, timeout) result = self._task(*self._args, **self._kwargs) if isinstance(result, types.GeneratorType): self._runner = result self.step() else: if not self.done(): assert self._runner is not None, "Task not started" if self._timeout is not None and self._timeout.expired(): logger.info(_('%s timed out') % str(self)) try: self._runner.throw(self._timeout) except StopIteration: self._done = True else: # Clean up in case task swallows exception without exiting self.cancel() else: logger.debug(_('%s running') % str(self)) try: next(self._runner) except StopIteration: self._done = True logger.debug(_('%s complete') % str(self)) self._runner.close()

commit_message:
Changes gate annotaton in compute images tests

This submission renames type=gate annoation to type=smoke in test scripts
images in compute module. Gate tag is removed as it is not implemented
and not serving any purpose.

commit_message:
Add replace to _disk_dev to ensure ! is converted to /

While later in the process than may be desired, this change is easier to
 propigate than to continue to loose it in the agent.

Change-Id: Ic3f3a8e835331129eb5daa33f3e431a646d966c4
Related-bug: #1291692

subject: Improve cloudserver resource logging messages
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-03-13 16:41:50.000000000', 'files': ['contrib/rackspace/rackspace/resources/cloud_server.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/heat/commit/11a3e54931e17d2f22a844b8dc5fdb1d7f7e161f', 'message': 'Improve cloudserver resource logging messages

commit_message:
Improve cloudserver resource logging messages

Add more information to the cloudserver log messages so that the
server resource can be identified.

Change-Id: Iee710d33dc7a3f4a9e9fc1b1765d94bc7f5f52c6

commit_message:
Refactor database migration manager to use given engine

Removing global engine object introduces some changes
to migration api.
Basically we need to move engine creation to outer scope.

In order to address these issues we need to refactor alembic api.

Realted to blueprint oslo-db-lib
Change-Id: Ia2f9586c4e9c31339dd7dcd9f45a58e8a8409921

commit_message:
Override oslotest time mock if need timing events

Some unit tests, like test_ssh.py, actually check the number of times
that time.time() is called during the test execution.
oslotest.base.TestCase.setUp() creates its own timeout fixture,
which interferes with the time mock calls.

Change-Id: I3abe834c36a9cda5277e4b1b39240a7145a9f6af
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tempest refs/changes/06/80106/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: import os def setUp(self): # Need to do this here, since parent setUp() in oslotest.base # mocks out time.time if OS_TEST_TIMEOUT is not 0. We need to # control time.time explicitly in these tests, so we override # any global environ variable for the during of the individual # test methods. self.orig_timeout = os.environ.get('OS_TEST_TIMEOUT') os.environ.set('OS_TEST_TIMEOUT', 0) super(TestSshClient, self).setUp() def tearDown(self): os.environ.set('OS_TEST_TIMEOUT', self.orig_timeout) super(TestSshClient, self).tearDown()

commit_message:
show deployment column on task list

When listing tasks using 'rally task list' a new column is shown displaying the
name of deployment on which each task was executed.
Default behaviour of 'rally task list' is now changed to display only tasks
belonging to currently active deployment. To display all task a new argument
'--all' has to be passed. It is now also possible to filter tasks belonging to
a specific deployment using '--deploy-id' argument.

Change-Id: I34fd710aa28fd02191117f21b9fef595ccf0f2b5
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/rally refs/changes/96/80396/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: @cliutils.args('--all', action='store_true', dest='filter_all', help='show tasks from all deployments') @cliutils.args('--deploy-id', type=str, dest='deploy_id', required=False, help='limit tasks to a deployment with this UUID') @envutils.deploy_id_default def list(self, task_list=None, deploy_id=None, filter_all=False): """Print a list of all tasks. :param filter_all: boolean, show tasks from all deployments :param deploy_id: a UUID of a deployment being used to filter tasks """ headers = ['uuid', 'created_at', 'status', 'failed', 'tag', 'deployment'] deploy_id = None if filter_all is True else deploy_id task_list = task_list or db.task_list(deploy_id) r.append(t['deployment']['name'] if t['deployment']\ else '(deleted)')

commit_message:
Add db health check to quota-usage command

For administration purposes quota-usage has been enhanced to reflect
on the health of the DB, by checking the data in quota_usages against
the volumes and snapshots tables.

Change-Id: I73d17b10278987f77ec061f6f841a4ace87daaf9
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-cinderclient refs/changes/34/74234/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def _quota_usage_show(quotas, volumes, snapshots): q_volumes = quotas.volumes['in_use'] + quotas.volumes['reserved'] q_gigabytes = quotas.gigabytes['in_use'] + quotas.gigabytes['reserved'] q_snapshots = quotas.snapshots['in_use'] + quotas.snapshots['reserved'] c_volumes = len(volumes) c_gigabytes = sum([volume.size for volume in volumes]) +\ sum([snapshot.size for snapshot in snapshots]) c_snapshots = len(snapshots) usage = [ { "Type": "Volumes", "In Use": quotas.volumes['in_use'], "Reserved": quotas.volumes['reserved'], "Quota": c_volumes, "Limit": quotas.volumes['limit'], "Healthy": q_volumes == c_volumes, }, { "Type": "Snapshots", "In Use": quotas.snapshots['in_use'], "Reserved": quotas.snapshots['reserved'], "Quota": c_snapshots, "Limit": quotas.snapshots['limit'], "Healthy": q_snapshots == c_snapshots, }, { "Type": "Gigabytes", "In Use": quotas.gigabytes['in_use'], "Reserved": quotas.gigabytes['reserved'], "Quota": c_gigabytes, "Limit": quotas.gigabytes['limit'], "Healthy": q_gigabytes == c_gigabytes, } ] utils.print_list(usage, ["Type", "In Use", "Reserved", "Quota", "Limit", "Healthy"]) quotas = cs.quotas.get(args.tenant, usage=True) volumes = cs.volumes.list() snapshots = cs.volume_snapshots.list() _quota_usage_show(quotas, volumes, snapshots)
deleted_lines: def _quota_usage_show(quotas): quota_list = [] for resource in quotas._info.keys(): good_name = False for name in _quota_resources: if resource.startswith(name): good_name = True if not good_name: continue quota_info = getattr(quotas, resource, None) quota_info['Type'] = resource quota_info = dict((k.capitalize(), v) for k, v in quota_info.items()) quota_list.append(quota_info) utils.print_list(quota_list, _quota_infos) _quota_usage_show(cs.quotas.get(args.tenant, usage=True))

commit_message:
deprecated cli option has _ rather than -

The deprecated_name option gets the - changed to a _, and this means the output
of --help is wrong.

Change-Id: I17ba6aeb5411248cc30ba282507dcde4c652aa36
Closes-Bug: 1279973

commit_message:
Enforce required parameters for endpoints

Currently, keystone.catalog.controllers:EndpointV3 does not check
required parameters passed in for a 'url', which is required for endpoint
creation according to the identity API V3 document. This change uses the
utilities provided in the common V3 Controller to check the required
parameters against what is provided by the end-user.

Change-Id: I0cdbc6e33f3b84e24b2bd8480d0cbe8e7c1a6587

commit_message:
Change IDENTITY_API_VERSION to v3

Currently, when devstack is set up, it defaults to v2.0 for the
Identity version. Given the mature state of v3, it's probably a
good time to switch over.
One of the larger side-effects of this change is that keystone
endpoints will also be changed.

Change-Id: Ibc3fccd06ba4796f4cf0c5128c724a58a5c2e879

commit_message:
Deprecate 'alarm-update'

Like deprecating alarm-create, we can use alarm-threshold-update and
alarm-combination-update instead of alarm-update.
So, mark alarm-update as 'Deprecated'.

Change-Id: I8c9718d76e40729dc6094611a055c904e27619ba

subject: Fix the explanations of HTTPNotFound for new APIs
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-03-20 00:28:04.000000000', 'files': ['nova/api/openstack/compute/contrib/server_external_events.py', 'nova/api/openstack/compute/plugins/v3/server_diagnostics.py', 'nova/api/openstack/compute/plugins/v3/instance_actions.py', 'nova/api/openstack/compute/plugins/v3/server_external_events.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/322bed90098c59244a903158262b5d938e90c08f', 'message': 'Fix the explanations of HTTPNotFound for new APIs

Nova wsgi framework gets "explanation" from HTTPNotFound exception and
outputs it into a response body as "message" attribute. Now some error
explanations are passed to HTTPNotFound exception without explanation
argument and they are not output to a response body. As the result,
the default message "The resource could not be found." of wsgi library
are output to a response body instead.

This patch fixes them to output right message to a response body.

The commit I80d3a2da6258e94c485ce024eb310a63bcf39773 has fixed this
kind of bug already, but it cannot cover the ones of new APIs. Then
this patch is necessary again.

Change-Id: Ia784e09cda986a421e83c2820dfd0a2267867cdd
Closes-Bug: #1285437
'}]
commit_message:
Fix the explanations of HTTPNotFound for new APIs

Nova wsgi framework gets "explanation" from HTTPNotFound exception and
outputs it into a response body as "message" attribute. Now some error
explanations are passed to HTTPNotFound exception without explanation
argument and they are not output to a response body. As the result,
the default message "The resource could not be found." of wsgi library
are output to a response body instead.

This patch fixes them to output right message to a response body.

The commit I80d3a2da6258e94c485ce024eb310a63bcf39773 has fixed this
kind of bug already, but it cannot cover the ones of new APIs. Then
this patch is necessary again.

Change-Id: Ia784e09cda986a421e83c2820dfd0a2267867cdd
Closes-Bug: #1285437
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/75/81675/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: raise webob.exc.HTTPNotFound(explanation=msg)

commit_message:
Eventlet monkeypatch must be done before anything

This patch ensure eventlet have patched modules before they are loaded
and used.

Closes-bug: #1288878

Change-Id: Ieb1fc252bde94a19fdba14a87c9f97848208bdc5

commit_message:
BigSwitch ML2: Include bound_segment in port

Includes bound segment in port create/update
requests to disambiguate when the parent network
has multiple segments.

Closes-Bug: #1294355
Change-Id: I59ef38aa5de46c1229384e0c4a9f0ee01c1bc678
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/67/81367/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: port['bound_context'] = context.bound_segment

commit_message:
Bugfix and refactoring for ovs_lib flow methods

Remove hardcoded flow parameters from
'_build_flow_expr_str' method, so we can
define any flows we want and can rely on 'ovs-ofctl'
command to verify flow arguments correctness.
When building flow string inside _build_flow_expr_str
use the following approach:
1. Build prefix and remove prefix params from flow_dict.
2. Build postfix (actions) and remove 'actions' from
flow dict.
3. Inside the loop build flow array from everything
what's left in flow_dict.
4. Append postfix (actions) to the flow array.
5. 'Join' flow array into flow string.

Change _build_flow_expr_str() to be a function
instead of an object method because 'self'
parameter  wasn't used.

Remove 'add_or_mod_flow_str' method because
we have to use separate logic when bulding flow
strings for 'add_flow' and 'mod_flow' methods.

Add more unit tests for OVSBridge class.

Closes-Bug: #1255058
Closes-Bug: #1240572

Change-Id: Ic89221d006a626aa2fc40314a9acffc0ea6fd61c
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/33/58533/18 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

deleted_lines: "priority=4,in_port=%s,dl_vlan=%s," % (ofport, vid, lsw_id)], add_mod_flow = mock.patch.object(self.br, 'add_or_mod_flow_str').start() add_mod_flow.side_effect = ['added_flow_1', 'added_flow_2'] flow_expr = mock.patch.object(self.br, '_build_flow_expr_arr').start() flow_expr.return_value = ['deleted_flow_1'] self.br.add_flow(flow='added_flow_1') self.br.add_flow(flow='added_flow_2') self.br.delete_flows(flow='deleted_flow_1') add_mod_flow.assert_has_calls([ mock.call(flow='added_flow_1'), mock.call(flow='added_flow_2') flow_expr.assert_called_once_with(delete=True, flow='deleted_flow_1')

subject: Change initial delay for servicegroup api reporting
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-02-06 01:53:14.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/48abc8e33286e40a67d9b2452bb5996d22bc477a', 'message': "Change initial delay for serviegroup api reporting

Initial delay should not necessarily be equal to
report_interval. Instead make it a resonable value
such as 5 seconds.

This is so the surprising behavior of a service not
reporting when you start it up doesn't happen if your
report interval is configured to a larger value.

For example, in an environment where there are many
services it may not be optimal to have them all reporting
every 10 seconds which is the default. You may have them
report every 5 minutes. It is confusing to start up the
service and not have it show as available until 5 minutes
later.

Fixes bug #1276883

commit_message:
Change initial delay for servicegroup api reporting

Initial delay should not necessarily be equal to
report_interval. Instead make it a reasonable value
such as 5 seconds.

This is so the surprising behavior of a service not
reporting when you start it up doesn't happen if your
report interval is configured to a larger value.

For example, in an environment where there are many
services it may not be optimal to have them all reporting
every 10 seconds which is the default. You may have them
report every 5 minutes. It is confusing to start up the
service and not have it show as available until 5 minutes
later.

Fixes bug #1226370

Change-Id: I85c4146bfa465fffaf89d4c2c74e6cb4ef84cee2

subject: Revert "VMware Driver update correct disk usage stat"
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-03-19 15:41:20.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/c858494ad543507fe9212e11e1f0e122fce273ec', 'message': 'Revert "VMware Driver update correct disk usage stat"

This reverts commit 9adba6727bbec051c1437ee95367ecb97b207f35.

Reporting aggregate storage space is not correct, since the nova
scheduler will assume that it can send a guest of that size to
the node, which the node will be unable to support due to lack of
contiguous disk space. The previous behavior was correct, where
the largest available chunk was reported.

Change-Id: Ia3a6e3f502282d44473d4908f68d71a97167e85f

commit_message:
Revert "VMware Driver update correct disk usage stat"

This reverts commit 9adba6727bbec051c1437ee95367ecb97b207f35.

Reporting aggregate storage space is not correct, since the nova
scheduler will assume that it can send a guest of that size to
the node, which the node will be unable to support due to lack of
contiguous disk space. The previous behavior was correct, where
the largest available chunk was reported.

Change-Id: Ia3a6e3f502282d44473d4908f68d71a97167e85f
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/63/81563/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

deleted_lines: self.assertEqual(stats['local_gb'], 2048) self.assertEqual(stats['local_gb_used'], 2048 - 600) # currently there are 4 data stores self.assertEqual(4, len(vmops._datastore_dc_mapping))

commit_message:
Fix misleading error message about failed dhcp notifications

This is achieved by adjusting the log traces and ensuring
that the right log errors are emitted based on the status
of the network.

Also, the patch drastically simplifies the structure of the
notification method and unit tests to increase coverage.

Closes-bug: #1289130

Change-Id: I7cc78bba81c516380fc93a68aa7b295312a88e29
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/58/79458/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: if (method == 'network_delete_end' or not utils.is_extension_supported( plugin, constants.DHCP_AGENT_SCHEDULER_EXT_ALIAS)): # with non-agentscheduler plugin, there is no way to query who is # hosting the network when the network is deleted, so fanout else: admin_ctx = (context if context.is_admin else context.elevated()) network = plugin.get_network(admin_ctx, network_id) if method == 'port_create_end': # We do not schedule when we create network because we want to # give admin a chance to schedule network manually by API chosen_agents = plugin.schedule_network( admin_ctx, network) or [] for agent in chosen_agents: self._notification_host( context, 'network_create_end', {'network': {'id': network_id}}, agent['host']) else: LOG.error(_('Unable to schedule network %s: no ' ' agents available'), network) if method != 'network_create_end': agents = self._get_enabled_dhcp_agents(context, network_id) active_agents = [x for x in agents if x.is_active] len_agents = len(agents) len_active_agents = len(active_agents) if len_active_agents < len_agents: LOG.warning(_("Only %(active)d of %(total)d DHCP agents " "associated with network '%(net_id)s' are " "marked as active, so notifications may " "be sent to inactive agents.") % {'active': len_active_agents, 'total': len_agents, 'net_id': network_id}) for agent in agents: self.cast( context, self.make_msg(method, payload=payload), topic='%s.%s' % (agent.topic, agent.host)) else: # It is hard to tell if we are in error at this point as # the network/subnet may have just been created. The only # way to tell for sure is if there were already ports # allocated, but the query may be expensive. Therefore # let's err on the side of caution and emit a warn trace, # so to alert the admin, who can investigate further. LOG.warn(_("No agents found for network: %(net_id)s. " "Notification %(payload)s will not be sent " "for event %(method)s. This may be an error " "if ports already exist. Please, diagnose.") % {'method': method, 'net_id': network_id, 'payload': payload})
deleted_lines: if (method != 'network_delete_end' and utils.is_extension_supported( plugin, constants.DHCP_AGENT_SCHEDULER_EXT_ALIAS)): if method == 'port_create_end': # we don't schedule when we create network # because we want to give admin a chance to # schedule network manually by API adminContext = (context if context.is_admin else context.elevated()) network = plugin.get_network(adminContext, network_id) chosen_agents = plugin.schedule_network(adminContext, network) if chosen_agents: for agent in chosen_agents: self._notification_host( context, 'network_create_end', {'network': {'id': network_id}}, agent['host']) agents = self._get_enabled_dhcp_agents(context, network_id) if not agents: LOG.error(_("No DHCP agents are associated with network " "'%(net_id)s'. Unable to send notification " "for '%(method)s' with payload: %(payload)s"), { 'net_id': network_id, 'method': method, 'payload': payload, }) return active_agents = [x for x in agents if x.is_active] if active_agents != agents: LOG.warning(_("Only %(active)d of %(total)d DHCP agents " "associated with network '%(net_id)s' are " "marked as active, so notifications may " "be sent to inactive agents."), { 'active': len(active_agents), 'total': len(agents), 'net_id': network_id, }) for agent in agents: self.cast( context, self.make_msg(method, payload=payload), topic='%s.%s' % (agent.topic, agent.host)) else: # besides the non-agentscheduler plugin, # There is no way to query who is hosting the network # when the network is deleted, so we need to fanout

subject: Specify spacing on periodic_tasks in manager.py
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-02-04 11:23:54.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/b5679e266ea6d9f2ece0a7057415e9446511736d', 'message': 'Specify spacing on periodic_tasks in manager.py

Some methods in compute/manager.py were using the @periodic_task
decorator to ensure they were called regularly, but were not passing
in the `spacing` kwarg.  In this case the method can only be called at
the default rate, calculated as min(60 seconds, <spacings from all
periodic_tasks>), regardless of the poll interval set in config.

Although there is throttling code which prevents the methods from
executing too often, the case where we do want the method to execute
very often was missed.  This patch ensures that setting the config
values low will cause the method to be called as frequently.

Change-Id: I1530c8b3b6ac71f4d9e2e41188c0eca4a6556e01
Closes-Bug: #1274317

Although there was throttling code which prevented the methods from
executing too often, the case where we do want the method to execute
very often was missed.  This patch ensures that setting the config
values low will cause the method to be called as frequently.

Change-Id: I1530c8b3b6ac71f4d9e2e41188c0eca4a6556e01
Closes-Bug: #1274317

commit_message:
Specify spacing on periodic_tasks in manager.py

Some methods in compute/manager.py were using the @periodic_task
decorator to ensure they were called regularly, but were not passing
in the `spacing` kwarg.  In this case the method can only be called at
the default rate, calculated as min(60 seconds, <spacings from all
periodic_tasks>), regardless of the poll interval set in config.

Although there was throttling code which prevented the methods from
executing too often, the case where we do want the method to execute
very often was missed.  This patch ensures that setting the config
values low will cause the method to be called as frequently.

Change-Id: I1530c8b3b6ac71f4d9e2e41188c0eca4a6556e01
Closes-Bug: #1274317
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/54/70954/13 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: @periodic_task.periodic_task( spacing=CONF.heal_instance_info_cache_interval) @periodic_task.periodic_task(spacing=CONF.bandwidth_poll_interval) @periodic_task.periodic_task(spacing=CONF.volume_usage_poll_interval)

commit_message:
Stop printing network diagnostics

Once I256c31312fa97dbc3aa44732cae99d066b57d223 merges, the same data
will be getting added at the start of job logs by the job
configuration so it becomes redundant here.

Change-Id: Ibc64753e5a26197cefe97d6866e921082429ef37

commit_message:
Remove the nova.config.sample file

This file is not gated anymore and therefore it gets
out of date. Replacing it with a README that explains
how to generate it

DocImpact
Closes-Bug: 1294774
Change-Id: I2a72a005208a2c86d69ac461d72e54c53bd395cf
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/88/81588/5 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: To generate the sample nova.conf file, run the following command from the top level of the nova diectory. tools/config/generate_sample.sh -b . -p nova -o etc/nova

subject: ML2: Remove validate_port_binding() and unbind_port()
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-03-11 02:43:19.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/7ee6774711c5417867933ca47fa6f00629a8fbb6', 'message': "Remove validate_port_binding() and unbind_port()

patch removes the other two methods from the MechanismDriver API.

The validate_port_binding() method was previously called on the bound
mechanism driver to check whether an existing binding was still valid,
so that the port could be rebound if something changed. But since nova
has no way to handle changes to binding:vif_type or

values are changed.

driver as an existing binding was removed. This methods was not used
by any existing mechanism drivers, and was redundant with the
update_port_precommit() and update_port_postcommit() methods that are
called on all mechanism drivers when an existing binding is
removed, so this method has also been removed from the driver API.

commit_message:
ML2: Remove validate_port_binding() and unbind_port()

The API implemented by ML2 mechanism drivers included three methods
related to port binding that were called within DB transactions, but
that could potentially involve communication with controllers or
devices that should not be done within transactions. A subsequent
patch will move the calls to bind_port() outside of tranactions. This
patch eliminates the other two methods from the MechanismDriver API.

The validate_port_binding() method was previously called on the bound
mechanism driver to check whether an existing binding was still valid,
so that the port could be rebound if something changed. But since nova
has no way to handle changes to binding:vif_type or
binding:vif_details after a port is initially plugged, this turned out
not to be useful, so the method has been removed from the
MechanismDriver API. Now, once a port is successfully bound, the
binding remains until the port is deleted or any of it's
binding:host_id, binding:vnic_type, or binding:profile attribute
values are changed.

The unbind_port() method was previously called on the bound mechanism
driver as an existing binding was removed. This method was not used by
any existing mechanism drivers, and was redundant with the
update_port_precommit() and update_port_postcommit() methods that are
called on all mechanism drivers when an existing binding is removed,
so this method has also been removed from the driver API.

Eliminating the unbind_port() call allows the binding details to be
made available via the PortContext in delete_port_postcommit() calls,
completing the resolution of bug 1276395.

Closes-bug: 1276395
Partial-bug: 1276391
Change-Id: I70fb65b478373c4f07f5273baa097fc50e5ba2ef
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/11/79511/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: binding.segment): self._delete_port_binding(mech_context) binding.vif_type = portbindings.VIF_TYPE_UNBOUND binding.vif_details = '' binding.driver = None binding.segment = None

commit_message:
Fix cinder quota cleanup

The cinder quota update test is setting default quotas for volume types
that might have been removed while we were running tests. Only update
the default quotas for the global values.

https://review.openstack.org/#/c/81503 fixed the test comparison which
was also broken, now the race condition hits in the cleanup.

Change-Id: I496e699e3b805aa2130ed39476008a6cd2b0cb6d
Closes-Bug: 1294824

commit_message:
Revert "Port to oslo.messaging"

This reverts commit bcd9f363ff8a10ff30795c54f471a8c6d76450fe

We have one thing after another popping up around this and
given where we're at in the release stage I'm not willing to
accept any more risk on this.

The concept behind oslo-incubator and going to libs I thought
was that these things would bsicly be just drop in replacements.
That's definitely proving to NOT be the case.  There were a number
of issues (some of the same that we have here) encounted with merging
this to Nova that a number of people worked on.  I have looked at
pulling those in and making a number of adjustments, but it seems to
be turning into "whack-a-mole", fix one thing another issue pops
up to take it's place.

Issues introduced by new oslo.messaging:

Change-Id: I39cc75ae1d9bac7d1474a1cb38f6917049afb532
Related-Bug: 1294724
Related-Bug: 1294949

commit_message:
Make compute use quota object existing function

There are several places which check the admin project_id and
user_id with instance project_id and user_id in compute.
There is already a helper function in quota objects, make the code
use the existing one.

Change-Id: I73e7e53ad15eda3788607a1be09c27215d09bda1

commit_message:
Change the sample_type from tuple to string

The Collector can not persistence compute node CPU metrics when set
compute_monitors = ComputeDriverCPUMonitor in nova.
The root cause of that issue is the counter_type is the 'tuple',
In actually the type of the counter_type should be String,
so it can not persistence to DB success, please refer to the SQL,
the counter_type value is [u'cumulative'] that is a 'tuple'.

Change-Id: I8d1218f813d081e1031c331c59a17c227c9a8958
Closes-Bug: #1295004

commit_message:
Catch NotImplementedError on Network Associate

When trying to associate/disassociate a network both for project/host
using neutron a 500 error is returned because the "associate" method is
not even defined in neutronv2 api.

The changes are:
   * Add missing associate method to neutronv2 api and raise
     NotImplementedError
   * Catch NotImplementedError on the API to return the proper error
     code on network associate/disassociate operations.
   * Catch NotImplementedError on os_network when associating a network

Closes-Bug: #1293539
Change-Id: I75b980500f0f171b065b7606baf201ab89848e92

Stop printing "Solum Python Command..."

We know what tool it is, that's why we are using it.
None of the other OpenStack clients do this.

commit_message:
Change plan_uuid to plan_uri in assembly

This is what we have at the moment, and we should support plan's being elsewhere.

-Modified test asserts as they were passing even with the change.
-Update the help command output with the 'Assembly Create' change

Co-Authored-By: Murali Allada <murali.allada@rackspace.com>
Change-Id: I7a1dccadb55138ad461cc830f4c35f5c5920857b

commit_message:
Always create o-a-c's $TEMPLATE_ROOT

Creating $TEMPLATE_ROOT is common to both os-apply-config package and
source installs, so move it into it's own install hook script under
install.d.

Change-Id: Iba79129cd111c144f67efabb93d4eb81641d1c2c
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-image-elements refs/changes/14/81614/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: #!/bin/bash set -eux TEMPLATE_ROOT=$(os-apply-config --print-templates) mkdir -p $TEMPLATE_ROOT

commit_message:
Make os-refresh-config install.d hook run later

os-refresh-config relies on being able to run virtualenv, which is only
guaranteed to be possible after running 01-install-pip from the
pip-and-virtualenv element.

To guarantee this ordering, move
install.d/os-refresh-config-source-install/01-os-refresh-config to
install.d/os-refresh-config-source-install/10-os-refresh-config

And for consistency in script execution timing, move
install.d/os-refresh-config-package-install/01-os-refresh-config to
install.d/os-refresh-config-package-install/10-os-refresh-config

Change-Id: I3b0a127c0c6eca16854f84a3c733cbd54c8a4880
Closes-Bug: #1292514

commit_message:
Remove many references to github

OpenStack's primary git repositories aren't on github, so update the
URLs en-masse to point to git.o.o. There are some references left as
they either reference code that is only on github, or require it,
like the Jenkins element.

Change-Id: Id50f2e0fc0b301b5b2d04f769d032044cd11404c

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-03-02 08:47:51.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/heat/commit/6ea86fdf71d33bd5715df4a0aa11de10d22069e0', 'message': "Tidy up urlfetch.py exception handling

1. IOError doesn't seem appropiate for things like invalid URL scheme
and template exceeding max size.
2. urlutils.URLError is already an IOError, and needs not be wrapped

3. requests.RequestException means an ambiguous exception occurred

"}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2014-03-02 15:10:29.000000000', 'files': ['heat/common/urlfetch.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/heat/commit/87fd145b27ca0f1279e28511be91890199c6fae4', 'message': "Tidy up urlfetch.py exception handling

and template exceeding max size. And requests.RequestException means

"}]
commit_message:
Tidy up urlfetch.py exception handling

IOError doesn't seem appropiate for things like invalid URL scheme
and template exceeding max size. And requests.RequestException means
an ambiguous exception occurred while handling requests, not
necessarily an IO error.

Change-Id: I21925a75d910a6ed51391322a3fa7c3bbe3acb6b
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/heat refs/changes/13/77413/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Replace str with six.text_type

Replace str with six.text_type for furture enablement of lazy
translation and PY3 compatibility - not using unicode().

Change-Id: I06ec94094c9cab8c8094794b4f27dba7f87c0d5c
