subject: Enable to select an RPC handling plugin under Metaplugin
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-03-12 06:32:24.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/605348ca2947994d076c76f1d1411e7f6ebd43bd', 'message': "Enable to select an RPC handling plugin under Metaplugin

Multiple plugins under metaplugin become 'q-plugin' topic
consumers and a request from an agent is handled by one of
them randomly. Fortunatly most of RPC callbacks are common
for plugins but a problem occurs if an RPC is not supported
by the recieved plugin.

This is one of risks when using metaplugin. Fundamental fix
of this problem is difficult. But if one of plugin can be
selected for RPC handling, the problem does not happen for
many environment.

This patch adds 'rcp_flavor' configuration parameter to
select an RPC handling plugin. If 'rpc_flavor' is specified,
only the specified plugin becomes 'q-plugin' topic consumer.
If 'rpc_flavor' is not specified, the behavior is same as
previous one.

Change-Id: If133b054bba53829cebe63c1e0ebe6099eb1fd95
Closes-bug: #1267330

"}, {'number': 3, 'created': '2014-03-19 03:34:27.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/tests/unit/metaplugin/test_metaplugin.py', 'neutron/plugins/metaplugin/meta_neutron_plugin.py', 'neutron/plugins/metaplugin/common/config.py', 'etc/neutron/plugins/metaplugin/metaplugin.ini'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/b98704e80b030f3a7db60cf244e29521008e94f2', 'message': "Enable to select an RPC handling plugin under Metaplugin

Multiple plugins under metaplugin become 'q-plugin' topic
consumers and a request from an agent is handled by one of
them randomly. Fortunatly most of RPC callbacks are common
for plugins but a problem occurs if an RPC is not supported
by the received plugin.

This is one of risks when using metaplugin. Fundamental fix
of this problem (such as RPC delegation handling of metaplugin)
is difficult since each plugin needs to modify.
But when only one plugin has plugin specific RPCs and other
RPCs are independet of plugins, if the plugin can be selected
for RPC handling, the problem does not happen. Typical use
case of metaplugin such as combination of an agent-based
plugin and a controller-based plugin often applies to this
condition.

This patch adds 'rpc_flavor' configuration parameter to
select an RPC handling plugin. If 'rpc_flavor' is specified,
only the specified plugin becomes 'q-plugin' topic consumer.
If 'rpc_flavor' is not specified, the behavior is same as
previous one.

Change-Id: If133b054bba53829cebe63c1e0ebe6099eb1fd95
Closes-bug: #1267330
DocImpact
"}]
commit_message:
Enable to select an RPC handling plugin under Metaplugin

Multiple plugins under metaplugin become 'q-plugin' topic
consumers and a request from an agent is handled by one of
them randomly. Fortunatly most of RPC callbacks are common
for plugins but a problem occurs if an RPC is not supported
by the received plugin.

This is one of risks when using metaplugin. Fundamental fix
of this problem (such as RPC delegation handling of metaplugin)
is difficult since each plugin needs to modify.
But when only one plugin has plugin specific RPCs and other
RPCs are independet of plugins, if the plugin can be selected
for RPC handling, the problem does not happen. Typical use
case of metaplugin such as combination of an agent-based
plugin and a controller-based plugin often applies to this
condition.

This patch adds 'rpc_flavor' configuration parameter to
select an RPC handling plugin. If 'rpc_flavor' is specified,
only the specified plugin becomes 'q-plugin' topic consumer.
If 'rpc_flavor' is not specified, the behavior is same as
previous one.

Change-Id: If133b054bba53829cebe63c1e0ebe6099eb1fd95
Closes-bug: #1267330
DocImpact

commit_message:
Use neutron security groups in BigSwitch plugin

Configures the Big Switch third-party plugin to
use neutron security groups instead of nova
security groups.

Change-Id: I6bc3046ff0e70b8288a7c3f3d6f975376adc081a
Implements: blueprint bigswitch-neutron-security

Closes-bug: #1295088
Change-Id: Ia11f8ca36a02ca2e5f74de275df80faeaa5b7d39
'}]
commit_message:
Fix the type of the disk IO rate measurements

The type of the following measurements should be Gauge:
disk.write.requests.rate
disk.write.bytes.rate
disk.read.bytes.rate

Closes-bug: #1295088
Change-Id: Ia11f8ca36a02ca2e5f74de275df80faeaa5b7d39

commit_message:
Update selinux policies for mysqld

mysqld fails to startup when selinux is in enforcing mode. This is
because the data and logs were moved under /mnt/state and the selinux
policies were not updated to allow mysql access to the new locations.

Change-Id: I5ccf1078ad0edc066bab430580886ed6c253e153
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-image-elements refs/changes/07/74607/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Although os-apply-config will eventually create this directly, we need to create it # in order to configure selinux. selinux rules are applied in pre-configure.d step before # oac runs in configure.d step. if [ ! -d /mnt/state/etc/mysql ]; then mkdir -p /mnt/state/etc/mysql chown -R mysql.mysql /mnt/state/etc/mysql fi

commit_message:
Trove Manual Installation guide

Installation of Trove on a VM different from the controller node.
The openstack environment is Havana.
The Keystone service accepts only HTTPS connections.

According to the redstack script:
 - commands related to the datastore creation/configuration are updated.
 - details on the configuration files are provided.

Change-Id: Ie9bf7651c56f95f1b18ba77d586bfff5fa8874df
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/trove refs/changes/17/81117/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: =============================== Trove manual installation guide =============================== Scenario ======== 1) An OpenStack environment (No DEVSTACK/REDSTACK) with a Keystone service that accepts HTTPS connection. 2) Trove works on fresh new Ubuntu 12.04 VM. Base configuration ================== On the VM that will host the Trove service, execute a base configuration like the other OpenStack services (http://docs.openstack.org/trunk/install-guide/install/apt/content/ch_basics.html) installing only the NTP protocol and set the password for Trove. Installation ============ -------------------- Install dependencies -------------------- Log in as root user and execute the following commands: * Install required packages:: # apt-get install build-essential libxslt1-dev qemu-utils mysql-client git python-dev python-pexpect python-mysqldb libmysqlclient-dev * Some packages in Ubuntu repo are outdated, so install their latest version from sources:: # cd ~ # wget https://pypi.python.org/packages/source/s/setuptools/setuptools-0.9.8.tar.gz # tar xfvz setuptools-0.9.8.tar.gz # cd setuptools-0.9.8 # python setup.py install # cd ~ # wget https://pypi.python.org/packages/source/p/pip/pip-1.4.1.tar.gz # tar xfvz pip-1.4.1.tar.gz # cd pip-1.4.1 # python setup.py install # cd ~ You should use the last versions on https://pypi.python.org/packages/source/s/setuptools/ and https://pypi.python.org/packages/source/p/pip/ ------------ Obtain Trove ------------ * Get Trove's sources from git:: # git clone https://github.com/openstack/trove.git # git clone https://github.com/openstack/python-troveclient.git ------------- Install Trove ------------- * First install the required python packages:: # cd ~/trove # pip install -r requirements.txt * Install Trove itself:: # python setup.py develop * Install python-troveclient:: # cd ~/python-troveclient # python setup.py develop # cd ~ * We'll need glance client as well:: # pip install python-glanceclient Prepare OpenStack ----------------- * Create a tenant 'trove' and user 'trove' with password 'trove' to be used with Trove:: Create tenant # keystone --os-username <OpenStackAdminUsername> --os-password <OpenStackAdminPassword> \ --os-tenant-name <OpenStackAdminTenant> \ --os-auth-url http://<KeystoneIp>:35357/v2.0 \ tenant-create --name trove Creat user: # keystone --os-username <OpenStackAdminUsername> --os-password <OpenStackAdminPassword> \ --os-tenant-name <OpenStackAdminTenant> \ --os-auth-url http://<KeystoneIp>:35357/v2.0 \ user-create --name trove --pass trove --tenant trove Role, admin and user association: # keystone --os-username <OpenStackAdminUsername> --os-password <OpenStackAdminPassword> \ --os-tenant-name <OpenStackAdminTenant> \ --os-auth-url http://<KeystoneIp>:35357/v2.0 \ user-role-add --user trove --tenant trove --role admin Adding the user trove to the tenant service: # keystone --os-username <OpenStackAdminUsername> --os-password <OpenStackAdminPassword> \ --os-tenant-name <OpenStackAdminTenant> \ --os-auth-url http://<KeystoneIp>:35357/v2.0 \ user-role-add --user trove --tenant service --role admin * Create service trove: # keystone --os-username <OpenStackAdminUsername> --os-password <OpenStackAdminPassword> \ --os-tenant-name <OpenStackAdminTenant> \ --os-auth-url http://<KeystoneIp>:35357/v2.0 \ service-create --name trove --type database * Create endpoint that points to trove. Pay attention to the use of quotes ('): # keystone --os-username <OpenStackAdminUsername> --os-password <OpenStackAdminPassword> \ --os-tenant-name <OpenStackAdminTenant> \ --os-auth-url http://<KeystoneIp>:35357/v2.0 endpoint-create \ --service-id trove_service_id \ --publicurl 'http://IP_trove:8779/v1.0/$(tenant_id)s' \ --adminurl 'http://IP_trove:8779/v1.0/$(tenant_id)s' \ --internalurl 'http://IP_trove:8779/v1.0/$(tenant_id)s' Prepare Trove configuration files --------------------------------- There are configuration files for Trove services (each file named as the actual service): * api-paste.ini and trove.conf.sample - for trove-api * trove-taskmanager.conf.sample - for trove-taskmanager * trove-guestagent.conf.sample - for trove-guestagent * <datastore_type>.cloudinit - cloudinit scripts for different service types. For now only 'mysql' and 'percona' are recognized as valid service types. NOTE: file names must exactly follow the pattern, e.g. 'mysql.cloudinit' Samples above are available in $TROVE/trove/etc/trove/ as *.conf.sample files. If a vanilla Ubuntu image used as a source image for Trove instances, then it is cloudinit script's responsibility to install and run Trove guestagent in the instance. As an alternative one may consider creating a custom image with pre-installed and pre-configured Trove in it. * Edit the trove.conf.sample and trove-taskmanager.conf.sample files, adding the Rabbit Hostname for AMQP:: # AMQP Connection info rabbit_password = RABBIT_PASSWORD rabbit_host = RABBIT_HOST * Edit the api-paste.ini file adding some rows: Comment the admin_token string and insert the following: [filter:authtoken] paste.filter_factory = keystoneclient.middleware.auth_token:filter_factory auth_host = KEYSTONE_HOST auth_port = 35357 auth_protocol = https #admin_token = xxxxxxxxxxxxxx admin_user = trove admin_password = trove admin_tenant_name = service auth_uri = https://KEYSTONE_HOST:5000/v2.0 # signing_dir is configurable, but the default behavior of the authtoken # middleware should be sufficient. It will create a temporary directory # in the home directory for the user the trove process is running as. signing_dir = /root/trove/etc/trove/ * Edit the trove.conf.sample file adding some rows:: [DEFAULT] default_datastore = mysql use_syslog = False ..... # SQLAlchemy connection string for the reference implementation # registry server. Any valid SQLAlchemy connection string is fine. # See: http://www.sqlalchemy.org/docs/05/reference/sqlalchemy/connections.html#sqlalchemy.create_engine sql_connection = mysql://trove:TROVE_DBPASS@TROVE_DB_HOST/trove?charset=utf8 .... trove_auth_url = https://KEYSTONE_HOST:5000/v2.0 nova_compute_url = http://COMPUTE_HOST:8774/v2 cinder_url = http://CINDER_HOST:8776/v1 swift_url = http://SWIFT_HOST:8080/v1/AUTH_ .... # Config option for showing the IP address that nova doles out add_addresses = True network_label_regex = ^NETWORK_LABEL$ .... # ============ notifer queue kombu connection options ======================== notifier_queue_hostname = RABBIT_HOST ... * Edit the trove-taskmanager.conf.sample file adding some rows:: [DEFAULT] use_syslog = False ..... # SQLAlchemy connection string for the reference implementation # registry server. Any valid SQLAlchemy connection string is fine. # See: http://www.sqlalchemy.org/docs/05/reference/sqlalchemy/connections.html#sqlalchemy.create_engine sql_connection = mysql://trove:TROVE_DBPASS@TROVE_DB_HOST/trove?charset=utf8 .... trove_auth_url = https://KEYSTONE_HOST:5000/v2.0 nova_compute_url = http://COMPUTE_HOST:8774/v2 cinder_url = http://CINDER_HOST:8776/v1 swift_url = http://SWIFT_HOST:8080/v1/AUTH_ .... # Configuration options for talking to nova via the novaclient. # These options are for an admin user in your keystone config. # It proxy's the token received from the user to send to nova via this admin users creds, # basically acting like the client via that proxy token. nova_proxy_admin_user = NOVA_USERNAME nova_proxy_admin_pass = NOVA_PASSWORD nova_proxy_admin_tenant_name = service .... # ============ notifer queue kombu connection options ======================== notifier_queue_hostname = RABBIT_HOST ... # ================= Guestagent related ======================== #guest_config = $pybasedir/etc/trove/trove-guestagent.conf.sample # Uncomment and set the cloudinit_location if it is different from '/etc/trove/cloudinit' (eg. /root/trove/etc/trove/cloudinit) #cloudinit_location = /etc/trove/cloudinit * Edit the trove-conductor.conf.sample file adding some rows:: [DEFAULT] use_syslog = False ..... trove_auth_url = https://KEYSTONE_HOST:35357/v2.0 nova_proxy_admin_user = NOVA_USERNAME nova_proxy_admin_pass = NOVA_PASSWORD nova_proxy_admin_tenant_name = service sql_connection = mysql://trove:TROVE_DBPASS@TROVE_DB_HOST/trove?charset=utf8 # AMQP Connection info rabbit_password = guest rabbit_host = RABBIT_HOST * Edit the trove-guestagent.conf.sample file adding some rows:: [DEFAULT] use_syslog = False sql_connection = mysql://trove:TROVE_DBPASS@TROVE_DB_HOST/trove?charset=utf8 ..... # AMQP Connection info rabbit_password = guest rabbit_host = RABBIT_HOST # Configuration options for talking to nova via the novaclient. # These options are for an admin user in your keystone config. # It proxies the token received from the user to send to nova via this admin users creds, # basically acting like the client via that proxy token. trove_auth_url = https://KEYSTONE_HOST:35357/v2.0 swift_url = http://SWIFT_HOST:8080/v1/AUTH_ nova_proxy_admin_user = NOVA_USERNAME nova_proxy_admin_pass = NOVA_PASSWORD nova_proxy_admin_tenant_name = service .... # ============ kombu connection options ======================== rabbit_host = RABBIT_HOST_IP * Create a mysql.cloudinit file in order to install both trove guestagent and mysql server into the instance that will be created. Prepare image ------------- * As the source image for trove instances, we will use a cloudinit-based vanilla Ubuntu image:: # wget http://cloud-images.ubuntu.com/precise/current/precise-server-cloudimg-amd64-disk1.img * Convert the downloaded image into uncompressed qcow2:: # qemu-img convert -O qcow2 precise-server-cloudimg-amd64-disk1.img precise.qcow2 * Upload the converted image into Glance using the command line tool interface:: # glance --os-username trove --os-password trove --os-tenant-name trove \ --os-auth-url http://<KeystoneIp>:35357/v2.0 \ image-create --name ubuntu_mysql --public --container-format ovf --disk-format qcow2 --owner trove < precise.qcow2 You can do it also using the dashobord. Prepare database ---------------- * Create the datatabase. Create the Trove's database where it is more appropriate for you (in the controller node, in the Trove's VM, etc...):: # mysql -u root -p mysql> CREATE DATABASE trove; mysql> GRANT ALL PRIVILEGES ON trove.* TO trove@'localhost' \ IDENTIFIED BY 'TROVE_DBPASS'; mysql> GRANT ALL PRIVILEGES ON trove.* TO trove@'%' \ IDENTIFIED BY 'TROVE_DBPASS'; * Inizialize the database:: # trove-manage --config-file=<PathToTroveConf> db_wipe mysql As an alternative, you can use: # trove-manage --config-file=<PathToTroveConf> db_sync * Access to Trove's database and insert the following rows:: mysql> INSERT INTO datastores VALUES ('a00000a0-00a0-0a00-00a0-000a000000aa', 'mysql', 'b00000b0-00b0-0b00-00b0-000b000000bb'); mysql> INSERT INTO datastores values ('e00000e0-00e0-0e00-00e0-000e000000ee', 'Test_Datastore_1', ''); mysql> INSERT INTO datastore_versions VALUES ('b00000b0-00b0-0b00-00b0-000b000000bb', 'a00000a0-00a0-0a00-00a0-000a000000aa', 'mysql-5.5', 'c00000c0-00c0-0c00-00c0-000c000000cc', 'mysql-server-5.5', 1, 'mysql'); mysql> INSERT INTO datastore_versions VALUES ('d00000d0-00d0-0d00-00d0-000d000000dd', 'a00000a0-00a0-0a00-00a0-000a000000aa', 'mysql_inactive_version', '', '', 0, 'manager1'); * Setup trove to use the uploaded image: Retrive id_image from nova:: # nova --os-username trove --os-password trove --os-tenant-name trove --os-auth-url http://keystone_IP:5000/v2.0 image-list | awk '/ubuntu_mysql/ {print $2}' Update datastore:: # trove-manage --config-file=<PathToTroveConf> datastore_update mysql "" # trove-manage --config-file=<PathToTroveConf> datastore_version_update mysql mysql-5.5 mysql image_id mysql-server-5.5 1 # trove-manage --config-file=<PathToTroveConf> datastore_version_update mysql mysql_inactive_version manager1 image_id "" 0 # trove-manage --config-file=<PathToTroveConf> datastore_update mysql mysql-5.5 # trove-manage --config-file=<PathToTroveConf> datastore_update Test_Datastore_1 "" Run Trove ---------- Run the following commands:: # trove-api --config-file=<PathToTroveConf> & # trove-taskmanager --config-file=<PathToTroveTaskmanager> & # trove-conductor --config-file=<PathToTroveConductor> & Try executing a trove command ----------------------------- * Create a troverc file with the following commands:: export OS_USERNAME=trove export OS_PASSWORD=trove export OS_TENANT_NAME=trove export OS_AUTH_URL=https://keystone_host.it:5000/v2.0 export OS_CACERT=/path/to/file/.pem * Source the troverc file:: # source troverc * Retrive the instances list:: # trove list # trove show instance_id Troubleshooting =============== No instance IPs in the output of 'trove show' -------------------------------------------- If Trove instance is created properly, and it is in the state ACTIVE, and is known for sure to be working, but there are no IP addresses for the instance in the output of 'trove show instance_id', then make sure the following lines are added to trove.conf.sample file:: add_addresses = True network_label_regex = ^NETWORK_NAME$ where NETWORK_NAME should be replaced with real name of the nova network to which the instance is connected to. One possible way to find the nova network name is to execute the 'nova list' command. The output will list all OpenStack instances for the tenant, including network information. Look for: NETWORK_NAME=IP_ADDRESS Suggestions =========== ...

commit_message:
Add update binding:profile with physical_network

Add temporary solution in order to support multiple physical networks
by mlnx ML2 MechanismDriver.
Due to non merged patches in nova that should support propagating
physical_network retrieved from port binding:profile attribute
to VIF/Network object.
The code will be removed once relevant nova patches are merged.
The code is disabled by default and should be enabled via
ml2_conf_mlnx.ini config file.

Change-Id: I815f9e28774efd47bccd1c57481e6ba89075792b
Closes-bug: #1291209

tests/unit: clean up notification driver

Some tests doesn't cleanup notification driver. So some tests can
run against unintended notification driver depending on execution order

commit_message:
Set IRONIC_VM_SPECS_RAM to 512 by default

Fix insufficient amount of RAM provided for fake baremetal nodes

Change-Id: I87d04a23a28dcb03dfdaf3c6cfad96cf2bda2516
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/devstack refs/changes/77/80977/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # NOTE(agordeev): both ubuntu and fedora deploy images won't work with 256MB of RAM. # System halts and throws kernel panic during initramfs unpacking. # Ubuntu needs at least 384MB, but fedora requires 448. # So placing 512 here to satisfy both. IRONIC_VM_SPECS_RAM=${IRONIC_VM_SPECS_RAM:-512}

commit_message:
Verify the response attributes of 'list_hosts'

This patch verifies the response attributes of list_hosts.
The response body of v2 and v3 API are in the same format:

"hosts": [
    {
        "host_name": "b6e4adbc193d428ea923899d07fb001e",
        "service": "conductor",
        "zone": "internal"
    }
]

Partially implements blueprint nova-api-attribute-test

Change-Id: Ia26d14e6fcec0e8f76224669ebde57ff8840605c

commit_message:
Unwedge stable branch: stop syncing trove and fix pypy

Remove trove from requirements sync in havana. Trove wasn't actually
part of the integrated release in havana,
so it's not getting actively maintained on the backports. Remove
it from requirements sync to help unwedge stable.

pypy is blocking all requirements merge at the moment, which is
problematic as we've got some changes that should land prior to
icehouse. Implement the work around that fungi posted to IRC by
backporting the tox.ini from master.

Depends on: Iab4ae1efddc4dca38dcd3779dae1a79ddc2b0852

Co-Authored-By: Sean Dague <sean.dague@samsung.com>
Co-Authored-By: Sergey Lukjanov <slukjanov@mirantis.com>
Change-Id: Ib2e2aa2e75e7b7b43e0534eeb62e748d1edc0bc3

commit_message:
Disable ceilometer's swift middleware

This middleware is spamming rsyslog with rabbitmq debug logs, making
this middleware practically unusable in combination with rsyslog. Because of
this, the rsyslog logs now account for 35% percent of the logs we store
in logstash. Until the underlying problem is solved disable the
offending code.

Change-Id: I50a73ae6beb1a11c41225340779fe8d7a1081e46
Related-Bug: #1294789

commit_message:
Validate get fixed-ips attributes of Nova V2 API

This patch adds the JSON schema for Nova V2 get fixed-ips API
response and validate the response with added JSON schema to
block the backward incompatibility change in the future.

The response body of V2 get fixed-ip API is below:

{
    "fixed_ip": {
        "address": "192.168.1.1",
        "cidr": "192.168.1.0/24",
        "host": "host",
        "hostname": "openstack"
    }
}

Partially implements blueprint nova-api-attribute-test

Change-Id: I1b8b2c00492e85e6075c036b41f28e68357da653

commit_message:
Stop running pip install -U when installing deps.

The pip install -U should only be necessary when site packages are
enabled. Novaclient doesn't need site packages enabled for any of its
dependencies so we can avoid the upgrade step during dep installation.

Removing the upgrade step is necessary to prevent pip on pypy from
breaking setuptools during dependency installation.

Note this does mean tests run on not latest version of everything.

Change-Id: I36a990e280832d399480e7f63dd7527e4b16e51e
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-novaclient refs/changes/23/81023/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

subject: Validate of Nova list Floating IPs attributes
commit_message:
Validate of Nova list Floating IPs attributes

This patch adds the JSON schema for Nova list Floating IPs API
response and validate the response of list Floating IPs API
with added JSON schema to block the backward incompatibility
change in the future.

The response body of list Floating IPs API is below:

{
    "floating_ips": [
        {
            "id": 1,
            "pool": "nova",
            "instance_id": null,
            "ip": "10.10.10.1",
            "fixed_ip": null,
        }
    ]
}

Partially implements blueprint nova-api-attribute-test

Change-Id: Ica266688af310bb804bcf7fb240ca6a005b156c0
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tempest refs/changes/86/80186/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from tempest.api.compute.api_schema.v2 import floating_ips as schema self.validate_response(schema.list_floating_ips, resp, body) self.validate_response(schema.details_floating_ips, resp, body) self.validate_response(schema.details_floating_ips, resp, body) self.validate_response(schema.floating_ip_pools, resp, floating_ip_pools)
deleted_lines: self.assertEqual(200, resp.status) self.assertEqual(200, resp.status) self.assertEqual(200, resp.status)

      "OS-DCF:diskConfig": "MANUAL"
    }
  }

      "links": [
        {"href": "http://[..]", "rel": "self"},

      ],
      "admin_password": "7XW3fhZpe6iF",
      "os-access-ips:access_ip_v6": "",
      "os-access-ips:access_ip_v4": "",
    }
  }

Partially implements blueprint nova-api-attribute-test

commit_message:
doc: deploying.rst improvement

- ReST syntax improvement (blockquote)
- suggest to rename config.json to local.json
  As adviced in I3129bf638e519f2b03a05cae482e26fd5aef40b1, the user
  should avoid changes in config.json, but use local.json instead.
- use local-config and stackuser element for bootstrap.qcow
- suggest the user of DIB_IMAGE_SIZE=30 env var

Change-Id: Ifc8672907a9b155273deda55cce80d3f5323ea47
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-incubator refs/changes/11/81011/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: - Copy tripleo-image-elements/elements/seed-stack-config/config.json to tripleo-image-elements/elements/seed-stack-config/local.json and disk-image-create -o bootstrap vm boot-stack local-config ubuntu The ``local-config`` element will copy your ssh key and your HTTP proxy settings in the disk image during the creation process. The ``stackuser`` element will create a stack user with the stack password. ``disk-image-create`` will create a image with a very small disk size that at to be resized for example by cloud-init. To simplify the initial bootstrap, you can use ``DIB_IMAGE_SIZE`` to increase this initial size:: DIB_IMAGE_SIZE=30 disk-image-create -o bootstrap vm boot-stack local-config ubuntu use ``tripleo-incubator/scripts/load-image`` as that will extract the something like:: nova baremetal-node-create --pm_user XXX --pm_address YYY --pm_password ZZZ COMPUTEHOST 24 98304 2048 MAC - Setup admin users with SSH keypairs etc. e.g.:: nova keypair-add --pub-key .ssh/authorized_keys default instead...):: sudo sysctl net/ipv4/conf/all/proxy_arp=1 arp -s <seedip> -i <external_interface> -D <external_interface> pub ip addr add <seediplink>/32 dev brbm ip route add <seedip>/32 dev brbm src <seediplink> - setup ec2 metadata support:: iptables -t nat -A PREROUTING -d 169.254.169.254/32 -i <external_interface> -p tcp -m tcp --dport 80 -j DNAT --to-destination <seedip>:8775: Also note that dnsmasq may have to be stopped as they both listen to \*:dhcps Disable the filter-bootps cronjob (./etc/cron.d/filter-bootp) inside the seed vm and reset the table:: edit /etc/init/novabm-dnsmasq.conf:: exec dnsmasq --conf-file= \ --keep-in-foreground \ --port=0 \ --dhcp-boot=pxelinux.0,<seedip>,<seedip> \ --bind-interfaces \ --pid-file=/var/run/dnsmasq.pid \ --interface=br-ctlplane \ --dhcp-range=<seed_deploy_start>,<seed_deploy_end>,<network_cidr>- upgrade your quotas:: nova quota-update --cores node_size*machine_count --instances machine_count --ram node_size*machine_count admin-tenant-id
deleted_lines: - Edit tripleo-image-elements/elements-boot-stack.config.json and disk-image-create -o bootstrap vm boot-stack ubuntu use tripleo-incubator/scripts/load-image as that will extract the something like: nova baremetal-node-create --pm\_user XXX --pm\_address YYY --pm\_password ZZZ COMPUTEHOST 24 98304 2048 MAC- Setup admin users with SSH keypairs etc. e.g. nova keypair-add --pub-key .ssh/authorized\_keys default instead...): sudo sysctl net/ipv4/conf/all/proxy_arp=1 arp -s <seedip> -i <external_interface> -D <external_interface> pub ip addr add <seediplink>/32 dev brbm ip route add <seedip>/32 dev brbm src <seediplink> - setup ec2 metadata support: iptables -t nat -A PREROUTING -d 169.254.169.254/32 -i <external_interface> -p tcp -m tcp --dport 80 -j DNAT --to-destination <seedip>:8775 Also note that dnsmasq may have to be stopped as they both listen to \*:dhcps Disable the filter-bootps cronjob (./etc/cron.d/filter-bootp) inside the seed vm and reset the table: edit /etc/init/novabm-dnsmasq.conf: exec dnsmasq --conf-file= \ --keep-in-foreground \ --port=0 \ --dhcp-boot=pxelinux.0,<seedip>,<seedip> \ --bind-interfaces \ --pid-file=/var/run/dnsmasq.pid \ --interface=br-ctlplane \ --dhcp-range=<seed_deploy_start>,<seed_deploy_end>,<network_cidr>- upgrade your quotas: nova quota-update --cores node_size*machine_count \ --instances machine_count --ram node_size*machine_count admin-tenant-id

commit_message:
Add source-repository element var setting script

Add a convenience script to enable quick setting of environment
variables for use by the source-repositories element in creation of
the tripleo images.

Change-Id: I02656242545dd2fe1f1fd65e1b06e1b5d1b0c924
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-incubator refs/changes/93/74393/5 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: #!/bin/bash # # Script to make git repository selection simple set -eu set -o pipefail SCRIPT_NAME=$(basename $0) SCRIPT_HOME=$(dirname $0) function show_options () { echo "Usage: $SCRIPT_NAME [options] local_repo [...]" echo echo "Export source-repositories element environment variables" echo echo "Options:" echo " -h, --help -- print this help." echo " -l, --local -- clone the local repository." echo " -n, --no-echo -- do not echo the variables exported." echo " -r <remote>, --remote <remote> -- use the given remote to get repository location." echo echo "Set the appropriate environment variables to use a local git repository" echo "for the input into image building via the source-repositories element" echo exit $1 } TEMP=`getopt -o h,l,n,r: -l help,local,no-echo,no_echo,remote: -n $SCRIPT_NAME -- "$@"` if [ $? != 0 ] ; then echo "Terminating..." >&2 ; exit 1 ; fi # Note the quotes around `$TEMP': they are essential! eval set -- "$TEMP" while true ; do case "$1" in -h|--help) show_options 0;; -l|--local) USE_LOCAL=1; shift 1;; -n|--no[-_]echo) NO_ECHO=1; shift 1;; -r|--remote) REMOTE=$2; shift 2;; --) shift ; break ;; *) echo "Error: unsupported option $1." ; exit 1 ;; esac done export REPOS=( "${@}" ) if (( $# <= 0 )); then echo "Local repository location is required"; show_options 0; fi export REMOTE=${REMOTE:-origin} export NO_ECHO=${NO_ECHO:-} get_location() { local remote_name=${1:-origin} if [[ -n "${USE_LOCAL}" ]]; then pwd else git config --get remote.${remote_name}.url fi } get_ref() { git rev-parse HEAD } get_name() { local remote_name=${1:-origin} name=$(get_location ${remote_name}) echo $(basename ${name##*:} .git) } declare -A a for dir in "${REPOS[@]}" do pushd ${dir} > /dev/null 2>&1 REPONAME=$(get_name ${REMOTE}) a[DIB_REPOLOCATION_${REPONAME//-/_}]=$(get_location ${REMOTE}) export DIB_REPOLOCATION_${REPONAME//-/_}=${a[DIB_REPOLOCATION_${REPONAME//-/_}]} a[DIB_REPOREF_${REPONAME//-/_}]=$(get_ref) export DIB_REPOREF_${REPONAME//-/_}=${a[DIB_REPOREF_${REPONAME//-/_}]} if [[ -z "${NO_ECHO}" ]]; then echo "export DIB_REPOLOCATION_${REPONAME//-/_}=${a[DIB_REPOLOCATION_${REPONAME//-/_}]}" echo "export DIB_REPOREF_${REPONAME//-/_}=${a[DIB_REPOREF_${REPONAME//-/_}]}" fi popd > /dev/null 2>&1 done

commit_message:
Explicitly pip install pbr before its installed as dependency

When a pypi mirror is used with certain conditions installing pbr as a
dependency fails (see bug
https://bugs.launchpad.net/tripleo/+bug/1293812).
This is a temporary fix until the underlying cause is resolved.

Change-Id: Icfdaa20dc4471fe62a5e29e618d00779e31cbc72

commit_message:
Increase the default pip socket timeout

pip's default timeout of 15 seconds doesn't seem to be high enough
causing us to intermittently fail getting the pypi index. Increasing
the timeout in an attempt to make it less likely to hit the problem.

Change-Id: Ic5c85765e5cce9ccabcabc277b6e8f59b4451cdc
Related-Bug: #1272417
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/devstack-gate refs/changes/65/81665/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Change default PIP socket timeout to avoid intermittent errors # fetching the pip index, Bug 1272417 export PIP_DEFAULT_TIMEOUT=30

commit_message:
remove keystone-signing dir creation

The keystone middleware generates this directory automatically,
there is no need to pregenerating it (with potentially inconsistent
permissions).

Change-Id: I3858532307f9878691e55541bb43084677f5be68

commit_message:
Ensure alarm rule conform to alarm type

Threshold_rule or combination_rule must be set to an Alarm object,
and they cannot be set at the same time.
Alarm's type must be one of threshold and combination.
Threshold_rule and combination_rule should be validated according alarm's
type.

Change-Id: I97bf82defeaf0dc1a0e897e10886fd736361041d
Closes-bug: #1288677
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ceilometer refs/changes/87/78587/10 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: if alarm.type == 'threshold': if alarm.threshold_rule in (wtypes.Unset, None): error = _("threshold_rule must be set for threshold type " "alarm") raise ClientSideError(error) if alarm.type == 'combination': if alarm.combination_rule in (wtypes.Unset, None): error = _("combination_rule must be set for combination " "type alarm") raise ClientSideError(error)
deleted_lines: if (alarm.threshold_rule in (wtypes.Unset, None) and alarm.combination_rule in (wtypes.Unset, None)): error = _("either threshold_rule or combination_rule " "must be set") raise ClientSideError(error)

commit_message:
Add deleted_at attribute in glance stub on delete()

The glance stub used in unit tests sets the 'deleted' attribute to
True for the deleted image, but does not also add the 'deleted_at'
attribute, which should also be included, since that's how glance
actually operates. 'deleted_at' is missing from a few other places
as well; add it there for consistency.

Change-Id: I60a96f568d45a4f5fabdb146e0028c4cf680b9fa

commit_message:
Fix error trace induced by dhcp test actions

Once the agent is removed, we are unable to deallocate
dhcp resources for the port until the entire network is
torn down; this is fine, but by doing so we cause Neutron
Server to emit a log error.

This patch simply deletes the port before doing the
disassociation, however a cleaner way to deal with this
would be to avoid relying on port creation to trigger a
network scheduling, though, this would require a more
elaborated fix.

Closes-bug: 1292242

Change-Id: I187d8dd707d67eb39446a5558913331310bd1f47
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tempest refs/changes/18/80418/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # The only reason why we create a port here is to # have the network scheduled to the agent. # delete the port before disassociating the agent from the # network to ensure proper dhcp clean up cls.client.delete_port(cls.port['id']) # Remove the reference from here to avoid deleting again # during tearDownClass cls.ports.remove(cls.port)

commit_message:
Catch FloatingIpNotFoundForHost exception

When showing floating ips for a given host, the FloatingIpNotFoundForHost
exception isn't handled when no floating ips can be found for the host.
This patch fixes this bug.

Closes-Bug: #1289164
Change-Id: Ic25ffd66945fd40ba10d69515e0cbfeae840313c

commit_message:
Remove dependent module py3kcompat

Module py3kcompat was removed from oslo-incubator, we can use
six directly.

* Sync commit of removing py3kcompat from oslo
* use six replace usage of py3kcompat

Change-Id: If0f9397588b2180fe198e804cbbb5b5c8420fe76
Closes-Bug: #1280033

commit_message:
Add API sample files of "unshelve a server" API

Now there are not API sample files of "unshelve a server" and
"shelve-offload" APIs, and OpenStack API documentation also
does not show these APIs.
This patch adds these API sample files.

DocImpact
Closes-Bug: #1285482

Change-Id: Idf797eb6723b94abae71a77c12bc2bb9b330fa28

commit_message:
Add server to clean up even in case of errors

In the case of instance build times out it would never been added to cleanup so
we put it on the list before wait for it get ready.

Fixes bug #1292641

Change-Id: Id030457cfe038849b81008de18b5f93fc024a47e

commit_message:
vmwareapi:Fix nova compute service down issue when injecting pure IPv6

Use vmware center driver to static inject pure IPv6 address, since
IPv6 injection function still not be implemented, but it should not
throw exception, it will impact nova compute service work

Change-Id: I8d0835623202d48466a97798312b67f049ffb6c8
Closes-Bug: #1286006

commit_message:
Connect the completion of the image create to deploy

Change-Id: I3cf38519c258238b88af7b0f89e3adf219a14242
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/solum refs/changes/29/81229/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: import uuid from solum.deployer import api from solum import objects def _create_comp(self, ctxt, assem, name, description, uri): comp = objects.registry.Component() comp.uuid = str(uuid.uuid4()) comp.name = name comp.description = description comp.assembly_id = assem.id comp.user_id = ctxt.user comp.project_id = ctxt.tenant comp.resource_uri = uri comp.create(ctxt) return comp def build_job_update(self, ctxt, message): image = objects.registry.Image.get_by_id(ctxt, message['id']) image.status = message['status'] image.reason = message['reason'] image.created_image_id = message['created_image_id'] image.save(ctxt) # create the component if needed. if 'assembly_id' in message: assem = objects.registry.Assembly.get_by_id(ctxt, message['assembly_id']) if not any([comp for comp in assem.components if 'Image Build' in comp.description]): self._create_comp(ctxt, assem, 'Image Build', 'Image Build job', 'returned link from image builder') if image.status == 'COMPLETE': api.API(context=ctxt).deploy(assembly_id=assem.id, image_id=image.created_image_id)

Add an assembly.components property

This is a convenience getter to get the components that
belong to a particular assembly

Move the image creation into the rpc worker

This also moves the states into the worker api so they can be shared.

Change-Id: I46124ae164f4c8ed5bc4c04a7acc11277971d1ba

added_lines: import os import subprocess from solum.conductor import apidef tweet(ctxt, build_id, status=None, reason=None, glance_id=None): """aka: send a status update to the conductor.""" api.API(context=ctxt).build_job_update( id=build_id, status=status, reason=reason, created_image_id=glance_id) def build(self, ctxt, message): build_id = message['id'] source_uri = message['source_uri'] name = message['name'] base_image_id = message['base_image_id'] source_format = message['source_format'] image_format = message['image_format'] proj_dir = os.path.abspath(os.path.join(os.path.dirname(__file__), '..', '..', '..')) # map the input formats to script paths. # TODO(asalkeld) we need an "auto". pathm = {'heroku': 'lp-cedarish', 'dib': 'diskimage-builder', 'docker': 'docker', 'qcow2': 'vm-slug'} build_app = os.path.join(proj_dir, 'contrib', pathm[source_format], pathm[image_format], 'build-app') tweet(build_id, 'BUILDING', reason="Won't be a mo") try: out = subprocess.Popen([build_app, source_uri, name, ctxt.tenant, base_image_id], stdout=subprocess.PIPE).communicate()[0] except subprocess.CalledProcessError as subex: LOG.exception(subex) tweet(build_id, 'ERROR', reason=subex) return LOG.debug(out) # TODO(asalkeld) get the glance_id from the output and # record it here. tweet(build_id, 'COMPLETE', reason='finnished', glance_id='ffoom')

commit_message:
Add a context serializer for the messaging

Change-Id: I30e5d4d65abb90705977d74c75b8335573a30abb
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/solum refs/changes/21/81521/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: import solum.common.context from solum.openstack.common import jsonutils class JsonPayloadSerializer(messaging.NoOpSerializer): @staticmethod def serialize_entity(context, entity): return jsonutils.to_primitive(entity, convert_instances=True) class RequestContextSerializer(messaging.Serializer): def __init__(self, base=None): self._base = base or messaging.NoOpSerializer() def serialize_entity(self, context, entity): if not self._base: return entity return self._base.serialize_entity(context, entity) def deserialize_entity(self, context, entity): if not self._base: return entity return self._base.deserialize_entity(context, entity) def serialize_context(self, context): return context.to_dict() def deserialize_context(self, context): return solum.common.context.RequestContext.from_dict(context) serializer = RequestContextSerializer(JsonPayloadSerializer()) self._server = messaging.get_rpc_server(transport, target, handlers, serializer=serializer) serializer = RequestContextSerializer(JsonPayloadSerializer()) self._client = messaging.RPCClient(transport, target, serializer=serializer)
deleted_lines: self._server = messaging.get_rpc_server(transport, target, handlers) self._client = messaging.RPCClient(transport, target)

commit_message:
Make sure plan.raw_content is populated

Before this patch all the content was filtered out.
Also raw_content is now json and not a string, so we shouldn't
be doing json.loads/dumps.

Change-Id: Ia2ab2a4e14f56de095b3b56dd4869f879404865a

commit_message:
set ssl options for glance-api

lets you set the ssl cert, key, ca for secure api
connection.

Conflicts in manifests/api.pp solved.

Change-Id: Ie82a46eeca27897363273aab5e58fcf6f6fe1ae0
backport: havana
(cherry picked from commit e866507782dfc8c279f230a0b5223dd121a76277)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-glance refs/changes/61/81861/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: it 'should have no ssl options' do should contain_glance_api_config('DEFAULT/ca_file').with_ensure('absent') should contain_glance_api_config('DEFAULT/cert_file').with_ensure('absent') should contain_glance_api_config('DEFAULT/key_file').with_ensure('absent') end describe 'with ssl options' do let :params do default_params.merge({ :ca_file => '/tmp/ca_file', :cert_file => '/tmp/cert_file', :key_file => '/tmp/key_file' }) end context 'with ssl options' do it { should contain_glance_api_config('DEFAULT/ca_file').with_value('/tmp/ca_file') } it { should contain_glance_api_config('DEFAULT/cert_file').with_value('/tmp/cert_file') } it { should contain_glance_api_config('DEFAULT/key_file').with_value('/tmp/key_file') } end end

subject: Explicity set default notifier strategy
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-03-19 21:36:38.000000000', 'files': ['manifests/api.pp'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/puppet-glance/commit/1c377ebdfd48a80b1951d3dcc53a89b49ef688e2', 'message': 'Explicity set default notifier strategy

Havana claims to set this to the default, but in reality it does not. The default is actually set to qpid because oslo.config automically looks for default options in /usr/share/glance/glance-api-dist.conf, which in turn sets `notifier_strategy = qpid`.

Later version of oslo.config seem to have fixed this behavior and do not load *-dist* config files.

Change-Id: Ib69c8f322b1309c0280364f0639fa6edff36262d
'}]
commit_message:
Explicity set default notifier strategy

Havana claims to set this to the default, but in reality it does not. The default is actually set to qpid because oslo.config automically looks for default options in /usr/share/glance/glance-api-dist.conf, which in turn sets `notifier_strategy = qpid`.

Later version of oslo.config seem to have fixed this behavior and do not load *-dist* config files.

Change-Id: Ib69c8f322b1309c0280364f0639fa6edff36262d
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-glance refs/changes/39/81639/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # [*notifier_strategy*] # (optional) Expose where notifications are sent when images are create, updated or deleted. Defaults to 'noop'. $notifier_strategy = 'noop', 'DEFAULT/notifier_strategy': value => $notifier_strategy;

commit_message:
move the request_id logging into the expected place

We already have conventions on request_id logging in the oslo
logger, so we should pass the request_id in a way that it will
show up in the expected place in the format.

Change-Id: Id47a39561151a985c3a4aeb91f84a7717f1976a2
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tempest refs/changes/77/81777/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # if we have the request id, put it in the right part of the log extra = dict(request_id=self._get_request_id(resp)) self.LOG.info( 'Request (%s): %s %s %s' % ( self._find_caller(), resp['status'], method, req_url), extra=extra)
deleted_lines: self.LOG.info('Request (%s): %s %s %s %s' % ( self._find_caller(), resp['status'], method, req_url, self._get_request_id(resp)))

commit_message:
drop unused params for _log_request

Now that we have a svelt _log_request, drop the unused parameters
passed to it.

Note: we really need to do something about this duplication in
so many files and figure out how to have a common request path.

Change-Id: Ifb26cd352cc7d8bb2477088a400f624f9688a681
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tempest refs/changes/76/81776/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

deleted_lines: self._log_request(method, url, headers, body, resp, resp_body)

Switch over to oslosphinx

oslosphinx is now available as a replacement for oslo.sphinx that
won't conflict with oslo.config in virtual envs

Closes-Bug: #1277168

commit_message:
BigSwitch: Sync workaround for port del deadlock

Adds a synchronization barrier to the methods
that lock the port table to avoid the mysql
update-lock/eventlet-yield deadlock that occurs
with simultaneous port deletions.

Closes-Bug: #1292232
Change-Id: I8975a14a937a5843a0395ad7b599ebdc827565ed
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/88/80688/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from neutron.common import utils # NOTE(kevinbenton): workaround for eventlet/mysql deadlock @utils.synchronized('bsn-port-barrier') # NOTE(kevinbenton): this is a duplication of the super method # with the update lock removed. This can be removed if change # Id9edba66 is merged. def delete_ports(self, context, filters): with context.session.begin(subtransactions=True): query = context.session.query( models_v2.Port).enable_eagerloads(False) ports = self._apply_filters_to_query( query, models_v2.Port, filters).all() for port in ports: try: self.delete_port(context, port['id']) except exceptions.PortNotFound: # Don't raise if something else is doing work for us pass # NOTE(kevinbenton): workaround for eventlet/mysql deadlock @utils.synchronized('bsn-port-barrier') # NOTE(kevinbenton): workaround for eventlet/mysql deadlock @utils.synchronized('bsn-port-barrier')

commit_message:
Added the ability to manage the nova uid/gid.

Added the ability to manage the nova user and group ids. This is
necessary for users who want to use live migration on NFS, where the
nova uid and gid must be the same on all systems.

Change-Id: I8958c5081afa7ffa73b59fb9a30b63ca725fcc66
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-nova refs/changes/98/76298/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # [*nova_manage_user*] # (optional) Manage the nova user # Defaults to false # # [*nova_user_id*] # (optional) Specify nova user and group id # $nova_manage_user = false, $nova_user_id = undef, # when using live migration on nfs # the nova uid and gid need to be the same # on all systems for permissions to work if $nova_manage_user { group { 'nova': system => true, gid => $nova_user_id, members => 'nova', before => [ Package['nova-common'], User['nova'] ], } user { 'nova': ensure => present, system => true, groups => 'nova', home => '/var/lib/nova', managehome => false, shell => '/bin/false', uid => $nova_user_id, before => Package['nova-common'], } }

commit_message:
Add /var/run/[name] support for upstart

os-svc-daemon for systemd has the ability to add a service file to
create /var/run/[name] for a service.  This change adds the same
support for upstart.

Change-Id: I8e38b2a2df772dd64a1b66df0aa6ebb155bfd1c3
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-image-elements refs/changes/68/81868/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: echo " used to specify a non-standard directory name."function install_create_dir_upstart { local name=$1 local user=$2 local dirname=${3:-$user} $OUTPUT /etc/init/$name-create-dir.conf <<EOF description "Create /var/run/$dirname" start on (starting $name) pre-start script mkdir -p /var/run/$dirname chown -R $user:$user /var/run/$dirname end script EOF } if [ -z "$CREATE_DIR_ONLY" ]; then install_upstart $SERVICENAME $RUNAS $RUNCMD $* else install_create_dir_upstart $SERVICENAME $RUNAS $CREATE_DIR_NAME fi
deleted_lines: echo " used to specify a non-standard directory name. Ignored for upstart." install_upstart $SERVICENAME $RUNAS $RUNCMD $*

commit_message:
Use the common function auth_uri_transform

Auth uri transform logic has been moved to the common cookbook, so in
the image cookbook, the common fuction is used to transform the logic.
Another option auth_version is added to template.

Change-Id: If0fdf86c48f5b4860d8b488dd7ee16ca199e1536
Imlements: blueprint move-keystone-authtoken-move-auth-uri-logic

subject: Modify stack ID lookup to only use stacks:lookup
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-03-14 15:35:43.000000000', 'files': ['heatclient/common/http.py', 'heatclient/v1/stacks.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/python-heatclient/commit/8fe87b422dc0886d5aba6a56dfd125b33a9c74c4', 'message': "Modify stack ID lookup to only use stacks:lookup

Currently when we lookup a stack ID (fully qualified name/id) via
stacks:lookup, we also follow the redirect to stacks:show, which
is not allowed for stack users.  We don't actually need to follow
the redirect, as we already have the required ID, so instead we
return the redirect response, so we can just allow all users to
do stacks:lookup in the policy.

This is useful for clients who want to call API actions which are
allowed for stack users, e.g resource:signal without having to know
both the name and ID of the stack.

Change-Id: I6f079cbc7ac3c680f15941668b4efbe4c3c5d60d
Partial-Bug: #1291097
"}]
commit_message:
Modify stack ID lookup to only use stacks:lookup

Currently when we lookup a stack ID (fully qualified name/id) via
stacks:lookup, we also follow the redirect to stacks:show, which
is not allowed for stack users.  We don't actually need to follow
the redirect, as we already have the required ID, so instead we
return the redirect response, so we can just allow all users to
do stacks:lookup in the policy.

This is useful for clients who want to call API actions which are
allowed for stack users, e.g resource:signal without having to know
both the name and ID of the stack.

Change-Id: I6f079cbc7ac3c680f15941668b4efbe4c3c5d60d
Partial-Bug: #1291097
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-heatclient refs/changes/06/80606/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # We want to capture the redirect, not actually get the stack, # since all we want is the stacks:lookup response to get the # fully qualified ID, and not all users are allowed to do the # redirected stacks:show, so pass follow_redirects=False '/stacks/%s' % stack_id, follow_redirects=False) location = resp.headers.get('location') path = self.client.strip_endpoint(location) return path[len('/stacks/'):]

commit_message:
WIP: Assembly creation actions

    Added code to perform following actions when assembly create is called:
     - Parse plan 'raw_content' field to get artifact name and git_url
       The image builder service requires these attributes to build the DU.
     - Call the image builder service to build the DU.

    Also updated the trigger_workflow with the following code:
     - Using trigger_id get the assemby and plan objects.
     - Call the above mentioned code for parsing the plan and building the DU.

Change-Id: Ifd7ce022df40e7c0828bdcb475f79131ce16f5dd
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/solum refs/changes/80/80380/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: import jsonfrom solum.builder.handlers import image_handler raw_content = json.loads(plan.raw_content) for artifact in raw_content['artifacts']: name = artifact['name'] git_url = artifact['content']['href'] data = {} data['name'] = name data['source_uri'] = git_url img_handler = image_handler.ImageHandler(self.context) img_obj = img_handler.create(data) return img_obj.created_image_id
deleted_lines: # TODO(asalkeld) make this non-blocking. # TODO(asalkeld) create the image created_image_id = '44067e1f-353c-4ce2-9725-18025d22313c' return created_image_id

commit_message:
Fix tox.ini for both tox 1.6 and 1.7

The current way fails to work with tox 1.6 when building the translated
manuals.
Fix so that it now really works with both tox 1.6 and 1.7.

Note that this is a workaround for a bug in tox 1.7.

Change-Id: Ib1cf8ccfc162fe313b9f2be35b78f5004634f97b

commit_message:
Catch HostBinaryNotFound exception in V2 API

When updating a service with a wrong host or binary name,
HostBinaryNotFound exception will be raised.
However the ServiceNotFound exception which won't happen here
is caught instead of HostBinaryNotFound.
The similar fix has been merged in V3 API.
I64b138bad74c39d087addcd766b890c4076a2ce8

Change-Id: I37cf7a56c5478bb1273ef038bb197d80af0ae7b5
Closes-Bug: #1273139
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/84/81684/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: raise exception.HostBinaryNotFound(host=host, binary=binary) def test_services_enable_with_invalid_host(self): body = {'host': 'invalid', 'binary': 'nova-compute'} req = fakes.HTTPRequest.blank('/v2/fake/os-services/enable') self.assertRaises(webob.exc.HTTPNotFound, self.controller.update, req, "enable", body) def test_services_enable_with_invalid_binary(self): body = {'host': 'host1', 'binary': 'invalid'} req = fakes.HTTPRequest.blank('/v2/fake/os-services/enable') self.assertRaises(webob.exc.HTTPNotFound, self.controller.update, req, "enable", body) def test_services_disable_with_invalid_host(self): body = {'host': 'invalid', 'binary': 'nova-compute'} req = fakes.HTTPRequest.blank('/v2/fake/os-services/disable') self.assertRaises(webob.exc.HTTPNotFound, self.controller.update, req, "disable", body) def test_services_disable_with_invalid_binary(self): body = {'host': 'host1', 'binary': 'invalid'} req = fakes.HTTPRequestV3.blank('/v2/fake/os-services/disable') self.assertRaises(webob.exc.HTTPNotFound, self.controller.update, req, "disable", body)

commit_message:
NSX: Sync do not pass around model object

The NSX sync backend previously passed around a sqlalchemy model object
around which was nice because we did not need to query the database an
additional time to update the status of an object.

Unfortunately, this was add done within a db transaction which included a
call to NSX which could cause deadlock this needed to be removed. Now a
dict is passed around instead and proper transaction handling
is used when updating objects.

Change-Id: Id50abd8f2143b127d1ca81c360c1c6d400e1d74f
Closes-bug: #1281772

subject: Checking the type of auth_token, and fixing it if necessary
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2013-11-22 22:53:17.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/python-ceilometerclient/commit/9be33a130c9dad14264cfe387abce69153412426', 'message': 'Checking the type of auth_token, and fixing it if necessary

When creating a new Client object by calling the get_client function,
if the ceilometer_url is not passed as a parameter, but the token is
passed, the auth_token is converted to a lambda function.
However, when both the ceilometer_url and the auth_token are passed,
this conversion does not take place.
This fix checks if the auth_token is a lambda function or not.
If it is not, it creates a new lambda function which returns the
token.
Without this check, if a token was passed as a string, the
python client would throw and error, when trying to call
self.auth_token() in ceilomenterclient/common/http.py.

Change-Id: I3e564fcf17ce497546b75f0ab8c7ca0f6f2099df
Closes-Bug: #1254186

commit_message:
Checking the type of auth_token, and fixing it if necessary

When creating a new Client object by calling the get_client function,
if the ceilometer_url is not passed as a parameter, but the token is
passed, the auth_token is converted to a lambda function.
However, when both the ceilometer_url and the auth_token are passed,
this conversion does not take place.
This fix checks if the auth_token is a lambda function or not.
If it is not, it creates a new lambda function which returns the
token.
Without this check, if a token was passed as a string, the
python client would throw and error, when trying to call
self.auth_token() in ceilomenterclient/common/http.py.

Change-Id: I3e564fcf17ce497546b75f0ab8c7ca0f6f2099df
Closes-Bug: #1254186
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-ceilometerclient refs/changes/51/58051/7 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: token = ((kwargs.get('os_auth_token')) if isinstance(kwargs.get('os_auth_token'), type(lambda: None)) and kwargs.get('os_auth_token').__name__ == '<lambda>' else (lambda: kwargs.get('os_auth_token')))

commit_message:
Increase the default pip socket timeout

pip's default timeout of 15 seconds doesn't seem to be high enough
causing us to intermittently fail getting the pypi index. Increasing
the timeout in an attempt to make it less likely to hit the problem.

Related-Bug: #1292141
Change-Id: I5ecf009259b76973228c86ada7859b7897892956
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-ci refs/changes/15/81815/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # The default pip timeout (15 seconds) isn't long engough to cater for our # occasional network blibs, bug #1292141 export PIP_DEFAULT_TIMEOUT=30

commit_message:
Revert "Add default_volume_type as cinder api parameter"

This parameter is already managed by cinder::backends.

If it should be moved to cinder::api, a new change should be proposed.

This reverts commit cd7391c5e2567a081d5a214a80cb773caa1ae2c6.

Change-Id: I52e2b296be81db2e085bb3403b95bcb48d081821

commit_message:
Webhook DB schema and object model

- Removed trigger_id attribute from assembly DB schema.
- Added a new table 'webhook' with attributes - trigger_id, plan_id & assembly_id.

Currently trigger_id is an attribute in the assembly table.
However, trigger_id will be generated when we POST to plan (i.e while registering
the plan). At this time, the assembly does not exist, so we need to associate the
trigger_id with the plan and once the assembly is created, the trigger_id would
be associated with the assembly.
We will also be adding a separate 'webhook' API resource.

[Note: Read the entire discussion here - https://botbot.me/freenode/solum/msg/12219803/]

Change-Id: Iac633dccddb241e2997abde727517ec32eb519e0

commit_message:
Add RequestContextSerializer for rpc notifications

RequestContext should be serialized when sent via oslo.messaging. The
serializer is correctly used for the general RPC mechanism, but has been
forgotten in the notifier. This patch fixes that.

Thanks goes to eharney for noticing this and pointing it out!!!

Same bug existed in Nova (1275771)

Change-Id: I99a571ef74bbcd13bf801313eea145ea69f821e1
Closes-Bug: #1294724
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cinder refs/changes/51/81651/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: NOTIFIER = messaging.Notifier(TRANSPORT, serializer=RequestContextSerializer(None))

commit_message:
Fix race on container recreate

There was a path on container recreate that would sometimes allow db to get
reinitialized without updating put_timestamp.  Replication would of course fix
it up, but that node would think it's database was deleted till then desipite
just ok'ing a request with a newer X-Timestamp than the deleted_timestamp on
disk.

Change-Id: I8b98afb2aac2e433b6ecb5c421ba0d778cef42fa
Closes-Bug: #1292784

added_lines: from swift.common.utils import (normalize_timestamp, mkdirs, public, replication, lock_parent_directory) def test_DELETE_PUT_recreate(self): path = '/sda1/p/a/c' req = Request.blank(path, method='PUT', headers={'X-Timestamp': '1'}) resp = req.get_response(self.controller) self.assertEquals(resp.status_int, 201) req = Request.blank(path, method='DELETE', headers={'X-Timestamp': '2'}) resp = req.get_response(self.controller) self.assertEquals(resp.status_int, 204) req = Request.blank(path, method='GET') resp = req.get_response(self.controller) self.assertEquals(resp.status_int, 404) # sanity db = self.controller._get_container_broker('sda1', 'p', 'a', 'c') self.assertEqual(True, db.is_deleted()) info = db.get_info() self.assertEquals(info['put_timestamp'], normalize_timestamp('1')) self.assertEquals(info['delete_timestamp'], normalize_timestamp('2')) # recreate req = Request.blank(path, method='PUT', headers={'X-Timestamp': '4'}) resp = req.get_response(self.controller) self.assertEquals(resp.status_int, 201) db = self.controller._get_container_broker('sda1', 'p', 'a', 'c') self.assertEqual(False, db.is_deleted()) info = db.get_info() self.assertEquals(info['put_timestamp'], normalize_timestamp('4')) self.assertEquals(info['delete_timestamp'], normalize_timestamp('2')) def test_DELETE_PUT_recreate_replication_race(self): path = '/sda1/p/a/c' # create a deleted db req = Request.blank(path, method='PUT', headers={'X-Timestamp': '1'}) resp = req.get_response(self.controller) self.assertEquals(resp.status_int, 201) db = self.controller._get_container_broker('sda1', 'p', 'a', 'c') req = Request.blank(path, method='DELETE', headers={'X-Timestamp': '2'}) resp = req.get_response(self.controller) self.assertEquals(resp.status_int, 204) req = Request.blank(path, method='GET') resp = req.get_response(self.controller) self.assertEquals(resp.status_int, 404) # sanity self.assertEqual(True, db.is_deleted()) # now save a copy of this db (and remove it from the "current node") db = self.controller._get_container_broker('sda1', 'p', 'a', 'c') db_path = db.db_file other_path = os.path.join(self.testdir, 'othernode.db') os.rename(db_path, other_path) # that should make it missing on this node req = Request.blank(path, method='GET') resp = req.get_response(self.controller) self.assertEquals(resp.status_int, 404) # sanity # setup the race in os.path.exists (first time no, then yes) mock_called = [] _real_exists = os.path.exists def mock_exists(db_path): rv = _real_exists(db_path) if not mock_called: # be as careful as we might hope backend replication can be... with lock_parent_directory(db_path, timeout=1): os.rename(other_path, db_path) mock_called.append((rv, db_path)) return rv req = Request.blank(path, method='PUT', headers={'X-Timestamp': '4'}) with mock.patch.object(container_server.os.path, 'exists', mock_exists): resp = req.get_response(self.controller) # db was successfully created self.assertEqual(resp.status_int // 100, 2) db = self.controller._get_container_broker('sda1', 'p', 'a', 'c') self.assertEqual(False, db.is_deleted()) # mock proves the race self.assertEqual(mock_called[:2], [(exists, db.db_file) for exists in (False, True)]) # info was updated info = db.get_info() self.assertEquals(info['put_timestamp'], normalize_timestamp('4')) self.assertEquals(info['delete_timestamp'], normalize_timestamp('2'))

commit_message:
Removed deprecated connection attributes

This is a follow up change set that removes the now deprecated
messaging and database cookbook connection attributes for host and
port.  These attributes have been replaced with corresponding
attributes in endpoints.

blueprint increase-ip-binding-flexibility

Change-Id: I2a8676155c6e71bd7ea92d1f33145d073cd899d1

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-03-18 23:26:06.000000000', 'files': ['openstack_auth/utils.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/django_openstack_auth/commit/7ff623638dc36fc29e7fc643483509ce226b92f6', 'message': 'Reverting default keystone API to v2.0

Although keystone v2 has been deprecated, no services use v3 for
authorization. So passing a v3 token_id to other services results
in authorization errors. If the user logs into a domain other than
"default" the user see only unauthorized errors. Currently, when
logging into the "default" domain these authorization errors do not
occur merely because of a bug in keystone that does not validate
the token version. This will likely change some time in the
non-distant future.

Setting the keystone API version to v2.0 is the safest path for now.

Not doing a full revert because the rest of the fixes the previous
patch were valid and required.

Change-Id: I3583e729b5a006f9b7f5cbbe3388908c15de39ae

commit_message:
Reverting default keystone API to v2.0

Although keystone v2 has been deprecated, no services use v3 for
authorization. So passing a v3 token_id to other services results
in authorization errors. If the user logs into a domain other than
"default" the user see only unauthorized errors. Currently, when
logging into the "default" domain these authorization errors do not
occur merely because of a bug in keystone that does not validate
the token version. This will likely change some time in the
non-distant future.

Setting the keystone API version to v2.0 is the safest path for now.

Not doing a full revert because the rest of the fixes the previous
patch were valid and required.

Closes-Bug: #1294396
Change-Id: I3583e729b5a006f9b7f5cbbe3388908c15de39ae
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/django_openstack_auth refs/changes/98/81398/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Adds max attempts logic to retry_on_deadlock

Retry on deadlock can continue to infinity and produce
a timeout in an other part of code causing an increase
difficulty to debug the real problem.

Closes-Bug: #1268895
Change-Id: I094de796cb143d15b4afba87d55d95e5818fbc82
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/88/66188/11 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def _retry_on_deadlock(f, max_tries=5): """Decorator to retry a DB API call if Deadlock was received. :param max_tries: Configures the max attempts logic. (default=5) """ attempts = 0 while attempts < max_tries: attempts += 1 raise db_exc.Error(_("Deadlock occured on '%(func_name)s'. After " "%(attempts)d attempts, not able to fix it.") % {'func_name': f.__name__, 'attempts': attempts})

commit_message:
Make optional dependencies in tests optional

Optional dependencies in the test suite were not actually optional
once they were imported because the _factories dictionary was always
referenced to determine if there was a potential provider to
intantiate. This list was never cleared. To correct this the _factories
dictionary has been removed and tests that expect an optional dependency
now instantiate the Manager. The full registry from the dependency module
is used to populate the *_api properties on the test cases.

Unlike the other optional providers, revoke_api was not instantiated when
the routes were added. Added into this change includes fix to instantiate
the revoke_api manager in the add_routes method to ensure dependency
injection works properly.

Change-Id: Ibb660d34c5ef206b0c5416354fb799275c482f75

commit_message:
Adding Django 1.6 support

Bumping the upper version of Django to include 1.6.

Adding a tox env to maintain support for Django 1.5 and fixing
env for django 1.4

Implements blueprint django-16-support

Change-Id: I093b38f85bea1fbd7641571a3871a721abadd37c

commit_message:
Configuration for domain name

Add configuration options for domain name for the different account types.
This is in preparation for the introduction of a Credentials class.

Partially implements: bp multi-keystone-api-version-tests

Change-Id: I21c8c10e02d657a7ac8c8fb47ed96e82b03946bc
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tempest refs/changes/45/80245/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def add_fake_user(dct, prefix=None): pfx = prefix + "_" if prefix is not None else "" for item in ['username', 'password', 'tenant_name', 'domain_name']: dct[pfx + item] = 'fake_' + item class identity_accounts(type): def __new__(cls, name, bases, dct): if name == 'fake_identity': add_fake_user(dct) add_fake_user(dct, 'alt') add_fake_user(dct, 'admin') if name == 'fake_compute_admin': add_fake_user(dct) return type.__new__(cls, name, bases, dct) __metaclass__ = identity_accounts class fake_compute_admin(object): __metaclass__ = identity_accounts compute_admin = fake_compute_admin() class FakeConfigIdentityV2(FakeConfig): identity = FakeConfig.fake_identity() identity.auth_version = 'v2' class FakeConfigIdentityV3(FakeConfig): identity = FakeConfig.fake_identity() identity.auth_version = 'v3' class FakeTempestConfigProxy(object): _config = None version = 'v2' def __getattr__(self, attr): if not self._config: if self.version == 'v2': self._config = FakeConfigIdentityV2() else: self._config = FakeConfigIdentityV3() return getattr(self._config, attr)

commit_message:
Add default_volume_type as cinder api parameter

Adds a parameter to set the default_volume_type for the cinder api.
Cinder-api uses this value if in CLI the parameter '--volume-type' is not
given.

Change-Id: I6cdad0a90d249bdaa2729d201cf10d3b16dd96a1
(cherry picked from commit cd7391c5e2567a081d5a214a80cb773caa1ae2c6)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-cinder refs/changes/73/81473/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: should contain_cinder_config('DEFAULT/default_volume_type').with_ensure('absent') describe 'with default volume type' do let :params do req_params.merge({ :default_volume_type => 'LVM_iSCSI' }) end it { should contain_cinder_config('DEFAULT/default_volume_type').with( :value => 'LVM_iSCSI' )} end

commit_message:
set ssl options for glance-registry

lets you set the ssl cert, key, ca for secure registry
connection.

Change-Id: Ic0ab88ef14ea61fd42b2bc1811ca1b5a4180b4a4
backport: havana
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-glance refs/changes/15/78915/5 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: describe 'with no ssl options (default)' do let(:params) { default_params } it { should_not contain_glance_registry_config('DEFAULT/ca_file')} it { should_not contain_glance_registry_config('DEFAULT/cert_file')} it { should_not contain_glance_registry_config('DEFAULT/key_file')} end describe 'with ssl options' do let :params do default_params.merge({ :ca_file => '/tmp/ca_file', :cert_file => '/tmp/cert_file', :key_file => '/tmp/key_file' }) end context 'with ssl options' do it { should contain_glance_registry_config('DEFAULT/ca_file').with_value('/tmp/ca_file') } it { should contain_glance_registry_config('DEFAULT/cert_file').with_value('/tmp/cert_file') } it { should contain_glance_registry_config('DEFAULT/key_file').with_value('/tmp/key_file') } end end

commit_message:
Add CREATE methods to LanguagePack

Change-Id: I0a13a979f8e6ebbd8fe3286c7f2f16b5b899449d
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/solum refs/changes/66/79966/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: import uuid from solum.api.handlers import service_handler def update(self, uuid, data): """Modify a language_pack.""" db_obj = objects.registry.LanguagePack.get_by_uuid(self.context, uuid) service_obj = objects.registry.Service.get_by_id(self.context, db_obj.service_id) service_obj.update(data) service_obj.save(self.context) db_obj.update(data) db_obj.save(self.context) return db_obj def delete(self, uuid): """Delete a language_pack.""" db_obj = objects.registry.LanguagePack.get_by_uuid(self.context, uuid) service_obj = objects.registry.Service.get_by_id(self.context, db_obj.service_id) db_obj.destroy(self.context) service_obj.destroy(self.context) def create(self, data): """Create a new language_pack.""" s_handler = service_handler.ServiceHandler(self.context) new_service = s_handler.create(data) db_obj = objects.registry.LanguagePack() db_obj.update(data) db_obj.uuid = str(uuid.uuid4()) db_obj.service_id = new_service.id db_obj.create(self.context) return db_obj

commit_message:
Add missing tests for Service controller

Change-Id: I18819011b9019a1efef1d5d8a78062b3829ca488
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/solum refs/changes/08/81308/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: @mock.patch('pecan.request', new_callable=fakes.FakePecanRequest) @mock.patch('pecan.response', new_callable=fakes.FakePecanResponse) @mock.patch('solum.api.handlers.service_handler.ServiceHandler') class TestServicesController(base.BaseTestCase): def setUp(self): super(TestServicesController, self).setUp() objects.load() def test_services_get_all(self, handler_mock, resp_mock, request_mock): obj = service.ServicesController() resp = obj.get_all() self.assertIsNotNone(resp) self.assertEqual(200, resp_mock.status) def test_services_post(self, handler_mock, resp_mock, request_mock): json_create = {'name': 'foo', 'description': 'test_desc_service', 'user_id': 'user_id_test', 'project_id': 'project_id_test'} request_mock.body = json.dumps(json_create) request_mock.content_type = 'application/json' handler_create = handler_mock.return_value.create handler_create.return_value = fakes.FakeService() service.ServicesController().post() handler_create.assert_called_with(json_create) self.assertEqual(201, resp_mock.status) handler_create.assert_called_once_with(json_create) def test_services_post_nodata(self, handler_mock, resp_mock, request_mock): request_mock.body = '' request_mock.content_type = 'application/json' handler_create = handler_mock.return_value.create handler_create.return_value = fakes.FakeService() ret_val = service.ServicesController().post() self.assertEqual("Missing argument: \"data\"", str(ret_val['faultstring'])) self.assertEqual(400, resp_mock.status)

added_lines: Python bindings to the OpenStack Sahara API =========================================== This is a client for the OpenStack Sahara API. There's a Python API (the ``saharaclient`` module), and a command-line script (``sahara``). Each implements the OpenStack Sahara API. You can find documentation for both Python bandings and CLI in `Docs`_. The project is hosted on `Launchpad`_, where bugs can be filed. The code is hosted on `Github`_. Patches must be submitted using `Gerrit`_, *not* Github pull requests. .. _Github: https://github.com/openstack/python-saharaclient .. _Launchpad: https://launchpad.net/python-saharaclient .. _Gerrit: http://wiki.openstack.org/GerritWorkflow .. _Docs: http://docs.openstack.org/developer/python-saharaclient/ python-saharaclient is licensed under the Apache License like the rest of OpenStack.

The important part is the Apache2 header not who holds the copyright.
These copyright holder lines are often inaccurate and misleading, so
don't require one by default.

Note: Some companies require there employees to use these, so if someone

commit_message:
Remove Copyright holder line from template

The important part is the Apache2 header not who holds the copyright.
These copyright holder lines are often inaccurate and misleading, so
don't require one by default.

Note: Some companies require there employees to use these, so if someone
adds this line in there spec, we should allow it. We just don't want to
require one by default.

Change-Id: Ifd82752d4e220360ab1d8a6bcd3fc27cb10b7d65

commit_message:
Replace trigger_id by trigger_uri in Assembly API model

It will be simpler for users to copy/paste the uri than having to
contruct the trigger uri from the trigger id

commit_message:
Fix force_config_drive bug

force_config_drive is string in nova, it should be 'None' or 'always'.

Add mkisofs_cmd and injected_network_template options to support
config_drive.

Change-Id: I9fb72f13eaf7cfb6144e6e1933f69c6df64c9ec0
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cookbook-openstack-compute refs/changes/53/79253/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # If force_config_drive=always, force creation of config drive regardless of if --config-drive was specified in the API call <% if node["openstack"]["compute"]["config"]["force_config_drive"] -%> force_config_drive=always <% end %> mkisofs_cmd=<%= node['ibm-openstack']['hyperv-agent']['compute']['mkisofs_cmd'] %> injected_network_template=<%= node['ibm-openstack']['hyperv-agent']['compute']['injected_network_template'] %>
deleted_lines: # If true, force creation of config drive regardless of if --config-drive was specified in the API call force_config_drive=<%= node["openstack"]["compute"]["config"]["force_config_drive"] %>

commit_message:
Make max api request size configurable.

Make the maximum allow request size for the barbican api a configuration option.

Change-Id: Ied2c4c08ea845c45ba689d1daf6b83e42aa6a732
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/barbican refs/changes/86/81586/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from oslo.config import cfgMAX_BYTES_REQUEST_INPUT_ACCEPTED = 15000 common_opts = [ cfg.IntOpt('max_allowed_request_size_in_bytes', default=MAX_BYTES_REQUEST_INPUT_ACCEPTED), ] CONF = cfg.CONF CONF.register_opts(common_opts) raw_json = req.stream.read(CONF.max_allowed_request_size_in_bytes)

commit_message:
Add user_id when calling populate_roles_for_groups

The call to _populate_roles_for_groups was missing the user_id,
and was always defaulted to None.

closes bug: #1294781

Change-Id: Ic78c66a1cbd0a32630f7247f0176ced2de352921
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/keystone refs/changes/87/81587/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: group_ids, project_id, domain_id, user_id)
